review.reviewBody: Fit and finish was great, very easy to install, significant increase in carrying capacity.
review.name: Canyon XT Extension

review.reviewBody:
Wrote a more detailed note on Canyon XT page, so just a highlight:

- easy assembly to fit within Canyon XT.
- 2015 RAV4 stock crossbars are weak, so only loaded basket with approx 55+lbs camping gear for maiden voyage. Will upgrade crossbars to take advantage of basket's weight capacity.
- felt completely happy with a 4hr drive up to 75MPH, with plenty of turns and some average bumps (not offroading). Screws didn't loosen, and didn't notice much humming as other racks create.
review.name: 2015 RAV4 XLE, stock crossbars. Very satisfied.

review.reviewBody: I bought this a week ago to increase the size of my canyon xt. Fit perfectly, really improves the original design
review.name: Perfect accessory

name: Canyon XT Cargo Basket Extension

hasVariant.name: Cordless Helmet Mount
hasVariant.description: Buy the NiteRider Cordless Helmet Mount online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Strapped this thing on my helmet and works great! Purchased it with my Night Rider lamp and being helmet mounted is so much better than a handlebar mount. I  ride tons at night and this allows me to put light exactly where I turn my head!
After several seasons of use, the plastic latch is beginning to wear, but I will definitely purchase it again!
Absolutely love it!

Just picked up another. Now my summer and snow helmets each have their own!
review.name: Awesome
comment: Thanks for the review Garrett! Stoked you are getting out!

hasVariant.description: Buy the Orange Seal Versa Valve Tubeless Valve Stem online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The stem literally snapped in half this morning while putting air in my tires before a big ride. Whatever they're made from is ridiculously flimsy. Avoid these and get Stans No Tubes valve stems they're money and aren't going to break in half and shred apart like these pieces of garbage.
review.name: Worst valve stems

review.reviewBody: The valve sheared off near the core and got stuck in my bike pump when trying to inflating after second use.
review.name: Broke after 1 use

review.reviewBody: I had two of these valves fail on my now. I was simply pulling my pump attachment off after inflating and the valve core broke off near the attachment.
review.name: Awful

review.reviewBody: The valve stems are very cheap feeling. When I tried to inflate my road tire, the valve stems broke off at the valve stem. I replaced the broken valve stem with the other valve stem and it broke the exact same way. One of the valve stems broke off inside of my floor pump (JoeBlow Sport III) head. Each failed at only 35-40psi.
review.name: Don't waste your time - they break!
comment: Both of mine broke as well in the exact same manner.

name: Versa Valve Tubeless Valve Stem

description: Buy the Elite Direto XR-T online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Direto XR-T
hasVariant.description: Buy the Elite Direto XR-T online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I use this so much now and it’s so reliable. Thankful for having such a great indoor platform to rely on. Such a great addition to my home training studio.
review.name: Great reliable product

review.reviewBody:
Trainer was great until it broke.

I had this trainer and the large plastic pulley/flywheel cracked.  Since it is out of warranty now Elite says that I can pay to ship it to Italy and pay them to fix and then pay them to ship it back (estimated $400).  I can't replace the pulley on my own because it has to be calibrated by Elite and only Elite can do it.  

So now I am stuck with an expensive paperweight crippled by a $5 plastic part that costs over half the value of the trainer to replace.  

Be aware that they have 0 worldwide service and is something breaks you will pay a hefty price and something is going to break on it one day...
review.name: Cheap Plastic Crippled It

review.reviewBody: This is the second one I’ve had. The first had a mind of its own and would apply resistance whenever it wanted to!! Elite had me return it to Competitive Cyclist and they sent me an upgrade but it does the same thing!!!  Done with Elite, they just don’t have it together!!!  I’d stay far away from them!!
review.name: Elite Just Doesn’t Have It Together

name: Direto XR-T

review.reviewBody: I bought these googles a couple of weeks ago and used them for skiing in July in Chile. Very comfortable and clear googles. I totally recommend them for sunny ski days (look forward to the cloudy lenses).
review.name: Fully Satisfied!

review.reviewBody: I’ve had these for about a year now and I haven’t had any fogging up which is good due to their new ventilation system. The lenses are the main reason i bought these. They’re incredibly easy to switch out and are very durable. I haven’t had a single problem with them yet. I can clearly see the patterns in the snow too, if I couldn’t then I would have sent them back. They’re worth the price if you’re still thinking about buying them.
review.name: You definitely get what you’re paying for

review.reviewBody: I tried these on and decided I wasn't crazy about the fit. I compared these to the fit of my old Smith Squads and decided they were going to be too small, and they seem to pinch my nose.
review.name: nice goggles, but a little small for me

review.reviewBody: Performs as advertised. Easy to switch out lenses.
review.name: Great Product

review.reviewBody: I switched to the Smith I/O Mag goggles this season and was excited to try out my new photochromatic lens. I skied in the Smith goggles for six days, three days in Montana and three days in Vermont in different conditions - blue sky, low light, snowing. I'm thoroughly disappointed with the Smith googles. I struggled to see contrast with the Smith goggles even when I switched the yellow low light lens. I was compared the Smith Chromapop lens and my old Oakley Prizm lens on back to back runs. The Oakley Prize lenses provide significantly better contrast, definition, and sharpness. Sadly I wasted $270 on my Smith goggles.
review.name: Disappointing Lenses

review.reviewBody: Smith continues to exceed industry standards, not only for the quality of their prodcut, but also for standing behind their products.
review.name: Buy Smith or suffer the consequences

review.reviewBody: I love the goggles in that they fit great and work great. However, the lens scratch incredibly easily. I follow all directions and protect them at all times yet they always somehow end up scratched. I have had 2 lenses now scratched in as many years. My old pair of goggles went 5+ years without a single scratch
review.name: Fantastic clarity, but lens scratch easily

review.reviewBody: I Have a pair of the regular IO Goggles (non-mag) that I've had for years. They were getting a little old and had a scratch that bugged me. So I decided to upgrade and ever since wearing they constantly fog up. No matter what I do. I wear the same helmet and attire as my older IO's that have no issues with. I end up just throwing on my old ones so I can see and don't even wear my new mags.
review.name: These Fog up so much

review.reviewBody: Great fit with my Smith helmet. Peripheral vision is awesome. Easy swap out of lenses for different light situations
review.name: Great fit with my Smith

review.reviewBody: Great goggles - fast turn around on my replacements. Really appreciate your trade-in / lifetime warranty service. It costs very little to make these goggles and the margins on new ones are high. So I respect that SMITH is willing to maintain customer support by providing replacements at no additional cost.
review.name: Great goggles - fast turn

name: I/O MAG ChromaPop Goggles

review.reviewBody: I've really loved these. Some shoes with BOA can be uncomfortable across the top of the foot but these are TOTALLY comfy. Soles have great grip for hiking your bike back up to the top of the rocky bonus lines. I've had these for 8 months riding 2-3 times a week and they're still in great condition. I usually only get about a year out of riding shoes but I fully expect these will last longer.
review.name: Still going strong!

review.reviewBody: These shoes have been great! They're light and comfortable and the BOA tightening system is a treat for getting them on and off quickly. Great traction when I'm walking around to enjoy mid-ride views. On slabby rocks, I never hear my cleats clacking which also means no slipping around. They were comfortable right out of the box and by the second ride they felt broken in. Decent breathability too. I'd get them again.
review.name: Everything I love

name: X-Alp Summit Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Double Haul Convertible Duffel 100L Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The packaging was so compact I thought the warehouse sent the wrong item.  The bag collapses into a really small and flat carry bag.  When open, the bag is much softer and lighter than it looked on the website pics.  It's much larger when not zipped and the straps are not clipped.  Perfect for my boating gear hauling  needs. Doesn't get any better than this.
review.name: Wow, duffel to end all duffels

review.reviewBody: Haven’t been able to use this very much yet but the quality seems great and I love the big size. Since I live on the second floor of an apartment, this bag makes it easy to load up my camping gear and haul it with one go down to my car.
review.name: Quality and good looking bag

review.reviewBody: I use this bag for work. To put it in perspective, I can fit 6 50L framed backpacks, 16 sleeping bags in tote mode or a months worth of clothes. These bags fly great and hold up. The only thing that esperares this black from the Patagonia Black Hole Duffle is it’s water resistant vs proof but the tote mode is a great compromise
review.name: The bag of choice

review.reviewBody:
I love my 100L bag! Great Product. If I had the money, I would buy 10 of each item Nemo makes. I have a lot of Nemo products, and they are all great additions to my gear collection. For the 100L bag, it was much larger than I expected (100L is massive) even having multiple backpacks over the years from 10L to 50L. 

My 100L bag has been used primarily for overlanding. 

Things I like about the 100L bag: 

For its massive size, you can really cinch it down when you don't need all 100L's 
Giant zippers with a large leash on it. Makes zipping it up when full easier. 
Multiple handles and backpack straps. 
Biner loops
A huge side pocket, probably 10L's on its own!
Excellent material. You can't pick this thing up without noticing it feels and looks overbuilt. 

I haven't found anything I don't like about this bag yet but will repost an honest review update if I do come across something negative.
review.name: I love my 100L bag! Great Product.

review.reviewBody: This bag is my new go to. Massive capacity, tons of carrying options, durable materials and burly zippers... if you're looking for one bag to carry all of your/your partner's gear look no further. Easy to pack and easy to haul!
review.name: This thing is awesome!

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the 100L Double Haul to simplify gear storage and transport for camping and cabin trips. I was NOT disappointed. I could just about fit a small person into this! 
When I'm not transporting short people, this thing holds everything! My stargazer camp chair, large 4 person tent, sleeping bag and pad fit easily, along with my daughters little camp lantern and some clothes. All of that while maintaining the duffel configuration! Durable material stands up to being dropped and sliding down slopes well (personal experience), and the zipper is beefy enough to really compress things while zipping it shut.
If you're looking to pack your whole life into a duffel, this one should be your first choice!
review.name: Outstanding duffel!

review.reviewBody: I purchased the 100 liter thinking I’d rather have more than enough space than not enough—it holds A LOT. I also got this bag for many uses with initial intentions to carry my young son’s ice hockey gear for beginner classes once a week. It worked great for that but there are no ventilation holes so I might not use it as a dedicated hockey bag for multiple days a week for practice and games. The backpack straps are awesome if you need a more stable carry and use of both hands. I found using the opening a bit cumbersome when the bag isn’t full because it tends to want to collapse and close itself, but maybe it’s because it’s the XL 100 liter size. I got the black color and I have to say it’s a bit of a weird black to me because it had a green undertone which makes it look sun faded. It doesn’t bother me nor does it affect its functionality. Overall a very nice and versatile bag!
review.name: Massive space and excellent versatility!

review.reviewBody: I've been eyeing this bag for a while. I decided to purchase when traveling with our six month old. This bag fits everything and stands up to airport checked luggage abuse. It held everything the baby needed including a full size pack and play. It's super light so you don't waste weight when the airline limit is 40-50 lbs. No it doesn't have wheels, but we use this bag as a tote every day of our trips. Everything the kid needs for grandparents house, the pool, camping...it fits. Not to mention the worlds greatest grocery bag, ski bag, mountain bike bag, etc ... Fits perfectly in our roof box and I don't worry about anything getting wet from snow or rain when you clip the duffle straps. The storage bag it ships in doubles as a dirty closes holder. The only flaw is that this bag is so massive the structure to hold it open as a tote seems to fold over when freestanding. I actually put another duffle (black hole) inside this bag on the return flight; not a problem. The whole family was asking where to get one.
review.name: Huge, durable, convenient, what else do you want?

review.reviewBody: Bought this about 6 weeks ago for my search and rescue gear and love the padded backpack straps that allows me to have my hands free to carry other equipment. The bag holds an impressive amount of items and appears to be constructed with highly durable/quality material.
review.name: Holds impressive amount of gear!

review.reviewBody: We bought the 100L Double Haul simply because we wanted something massive, to stuff anything an everything into, for any occaison. We've got just about every size of The North Face basecamp duffel and wanted to try a more "open top" style of gear hauler, to access gear a little easier. So far, absolutely love it! It's been the go-to bag for mountain biking, for us. We can have all of our full body armour, pads, full face helmets, shoes, food, for 3 people...with room to spare. It's so nice to have it all in a single bag and still be able to open it wide and easily sort through the items. We really haven't used it much in the other modes, but I've tried it out and it's super versatile in that regard. We like the small pockets outside and inside, and also like you can connect the bag pouch inside to create another zippered pocket bag. One of the best things, and especially for such a massive bag, that it's folds flat for storage. So many folks have complimented on the bag, while we're gearing up, mainly on the size and ease of use. I'd highly recommend this duffel and we will be getting more of the smaller sizes to add to our adventure travel set. And, you just can't beat the product is certified bluesign and made from recycled materials.
review.name: The biggest bag you'll ever need!

name: Double Haul Convertible Duffel 100L Bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased this top to replace one that is several years old that had gotten a couple of moth holes. The fabric is a bit more substantial than it was then, but is still the lightest weight underlayer I own. The fit is still form-fitting enough to easily wear as an underlayer without it feeling bulky. Love the low, broad neckline, too - it makes a nice cami-like scoop for peeking out from under the top of button-up shirts. I have a couple of these in the short-sleeve style as well. I love that Icebreaker offers products like this one that are flattering and feminine and suitable for everyday wear.
review.name: Siren tees are perfect for everyday wear

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] skimpy and overpriced. i love much icebreaker but the sizing is wonky on some items. i wiegh less than 120 on a 5'9" frame...a large should be generous on my figure.
review.name: just too small and i am not large

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the style of this shirt but the arms are a little tight and the wool is a little itchier than some other styles.
review.name: Nice base layer top

review.reviewBody: Ordered the navy and undyed (off-white). Undyed is see-through and a warm off-white. Navy is opaque. Wish 3-pg, big tag was not sewn into seam! I'm 5'4", 120 lb., A cup - this is upper limit for XS.
review.name: Great Piece

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] IB has the best quality merino clothing and this top is not exception to that rule. It is soft and comfortable, great for a cool morning walk or to layer under other pieces on a colder day. I am acquiring a closet-full of IB merino!
review.name: I have this one on right now!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Cozy and soft: love the V neck and extra long sleeves. Perfect layering addition to be ever expanding Icebreaker collection. White color adds a glam factor to the style. Hike to tent to dinner.... Five bright stars and complements to the Icebreaker team. You "rock"!
review.name: Super fab layer. Cozy and glam.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I had an Icebreaker siren from years ago, which I love and it still fits great; it's a small. The new sizing is far too tight in the arms (??) and squeezes the torso hard. Too long in the body. I purchased a small and medium to test the new siren sizing, and both fit far too tight.
review.name: The newer cut of the siren doesn't work. Tight arms&too long

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very form fitting long sleeve top. I purchased a size S thinking there would be some give in the fit but there is none.
review.name: Form fitting

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I needed a white top-not off white. Otherwise-nice shirt.
review.name: Color not accurate

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this under the raspberry tee shirt, it perfectly matches the flower. My new go to casual outfit. The feel against my skin is lovely.
review.name: The color is perfect.

name: Siren Sweetheart Long-Sleeve Top - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I own the Clifton 9 and the Transport, both size 8. However, the Anacapa Breeze Low, sizes 8 and 8-1/2 were both too small as my toe pushed to the edge. The incline from the heal to toe is greater than in either of my current shoes. I wanted to love them but have found a better fit for my foot in my other two styles. Thank you for asking.
review.name: There is a shoe for every foot

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Tried my new Hoka shoues in difficult hiking trail. They were supercomfy, good foot support and I love the colour
review.name: I am happy with this purchase

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: THESE ARE NICE SHOES BUT RUN LARGE. GOOD QUALITY BUT I RETURNED THEM 3 WEEKS AGO AND STILL HAVEN'T BEEN REFUNDED THE CHARGE. CUMBERSOME RETURN POLICY. SINCE THEN, I'VE BOUGHT TWO OTHER PAIR 'LOCALLY'. THAT'S THE ONLY WAY ...
review.name: nice shoes but too large

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the color of these shoes. I ordered them because my other pair of HOKAs are wearing, these where tight on the toes and the heel part was hard. I am returning for another style.
review.name: Not as comfortable as my other HOKAs

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have 4 pair of Hokas and these are the best ones yet...love the look/style and feel!!!!!
review.name: Favorites

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I had ordered online one Hoka shoe previously, but I sent it back. The next time I took the survey that matched my walking/hiking needs to a shoe. Hoka said the best match would be the Anacapa Breeze Low, and they were right! They are perfect for street walking and hiking on the trails nearby me.
review.name: Thanks to Hoka for recommending this particular shoe!

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these shoes! But they do run a bit smaller than my other pair. I think it's because of the added padding at tendon. So just keep that in mind when ordering. Enjoy!!!
review.name: Great shoe would buy again

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This style does not have the comfort as my other HOKA shoes. The rim around the toe of the shoe causes discomfort. I originally ordered my regular size 8, but seemed too tight. I returned them and reordered size 8.5, but the toe was still not comfortable, but the size was right.
review.name: Not very comfortable.

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love them they look great on lots of compliments, the only thing the laces could be better. They untie easily when I don't want them too!
review.name: Great sneakers super comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I saw you for 3 months with them and the sole has begun to take off.
review.name: I wouldn't buy this product again.

name: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Women's

I get its suppose to be more of a fitted shirt and I have another layer over it anyways, but that's not ideal when working outside on a brisk Wisconsin winter day. review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer 2 Mid GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: They feel great and look great.
review.name: Love them

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer 2 Mid GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This boot immediately became one of my favorite boots I have ever owned and within a few miles became my all time favorite! First off the fit is small and and slightly narrow at least in a US 14. An Asolo 14 is easily 1/2 size larger than these, Lowa 14 is about a 1/4 size larger and same with Zamberlan.  The sole stiffness is perfect for a boot that can be used on and off trail with or without a pack. Gohunt calls them a 3 in stiffness when they are closer to a 4. They have excellent ankle support and are amazingly comfortable. Literally didn’t need to be broken in before I wore them on a 3 mile hike. Overall they appear to be very well made on par with other euro boots. 4 stars though why? After one hike one of the cord eyelets started coming out. It hasn’t fully failed but it’s growing in length. I ordered a second pair and so far they haven’t had the same issue.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer 2 Mid GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots are really comfortable and provide significant protection. These boots will last me for at least 10 years
review.name: Happy customer

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer 2 Mid GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Really stable and comfortable boots out of the box. Feels like a quality boot but I gave it less since the first time out the metal wire that holds the lace  connector mid ankle pulled out rendering that loop useless. I emailed salewa directly and waiting a response. Overall makes a good hiker with pack if that one issue was fixed but disappointed that it broke first time out.
review.name: Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer 2 Mid GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Ive owned these boots for a year. I am pretty tough on my boots. For context  I work everyday in them (Im a landscaper) but also use them for regular hikes,  so they have been put through it.  Break in period was unnoticeable and they felt amazing right from the get go. Very sturdy and I love the security I get for my ankles for the type of work I do but also my hikes. They are still flexible enough in the toes to crouch/kneel and working extended periods without discomfort and I love the rigidity but also flexibilty in the right places in these boots. 

 However I noticed a few months ago the waterproofing seems to not work nearly as well and even walking through long damp grass my feet get wet and they don't dry the fastest, this is probably my biggest complaint. The insole has bunched up at the toes and my feet are quite sore at the end of the work day. I'm not sure if this could be remedied by just replacing insoles or not but the boot has become much less comfortable to wear for extended periods where it was extremely comfortable in the beginning and no soreness in my feet by the end of the day. These boots don't get too hot during summer days but definitely get chilly in winter work. They don't dry out terribly slow but also not the fastest, which can be miserable in rainy weather, wet terrain or cold/wet snowy days. 

The exterior stitching and material has held together very well and nothing has begun to rip/split or tear other than one shoelace. This is probably the most impressive feature of the boots as many other boots I would have shredded externally by now. Tread on outsoles has worn evenly but has lost some grip and does not grab rocky, muddy trails or wet surfaces nearly as well but still handles decently enough. When I first got the boots I could tromp through anything without thinking, now I have to be a little more thoughtful and careful in certain terrain. 

Honestly one of the best boots I've owned other than the issues I'm running into with comfort, reduced grip and waterproofing and if these could be remedied I'd call these just about perfect. If you are only using these for hiking you'll be set for a while.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer 2 Mid GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: So far these boots are great! Easy break in and no issues whatsoever.

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer 2 Mid GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’m giving it 5 stars. I’ve worn the predecessor to these boots the MS MTN Trainer GTX. They were wonderful boots. When they updated them, I ordered a pair and have a few months on them now. Several weeks this fall scouting the mountains of western North Carolina, the mountains of Utah, Colorado, and southern WVa. The predecessor fit my heels and narrower foot perfectly. These new boots fit great in the heel and may have a little more room in the toe box. These new boots don’t seem as stiff. Even flexing them on the floor and comparing them to the older models, they seem to not be as stiff. But they have been as comfortable as their predecessor under a 45 lb pack in the hills and mountains.
review.name: Excellent boot under my hunting pack.

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer 2 Mid GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love this boot! Just ordered second pair after four years of heavy use wore out first.
review.name: Best hiking boot I’ve ever had

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer 2 Mid GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Boot did last long before the stitching started coming undone alone the toes and the bungee that holds the lace came out. Have tried calling customer no answer during business hours have left message never returned call.
review.name: Tested in the Rockies and did hold up

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer 2 Mid GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This is my 4th pair of Salewa Mid Trainers in Goretex.

The previous models have been awesome.  So far this one feels slightly softer, I'm not sure if it is the 'ride' feels softer or the sole is actually softer (I prefer a stiff sole on my boots).  Time will tell.  This is a solid hiking boot for anyone.

name: Mountain Trainer 2 Mid GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great quality! Can't wait for my child to wear next summer
review.name: Perfect swimming suit

review.reviewBody: great color and love the pattern. wish they would make more matching hats.
review.name: great quality

review.reviewBody: This is the second time I purchase this. His first one lasted for two summers, a little loose at first and then more form fitting the next year. With one of these and his waterhat, it only takes a little sunscreen and he is fully protected. Better for the planet, and less work for us.
review.name: I love these swimsuits

review.reviewBody: Our family loves these suits! We use them hard and they last about 9 months for us in NE Florida. They fit snug, offer great sun protection, are easy to get on (the 4yr old needs help getting it off sometimes, but the 7 and 6yr olds have no trouble) and are bright and easy to spot. We love having minimal skin that needs sunblock and choose them for their active fit. We don't have to worry about someone losing their trunks or bottoms in the surf and because they don't have a liner, we don't have to cut holes in the suit to get the fine grain sand out of the fabric-it all comes out in the wash. I recommend buying your kids current size-the room to grow works great and isn't baggy.
review.name: Love these suits

name: Vesihiisi Swim Overall - Toddlers'

review.reviewBody: Just purchased to transport mountain bike from Texas to Utah.  It installs easily and the locking mechanism is great but we had to buy zip ties 500 miles into the trip to hold the forks together.  The wheel was separating them and coming loose.  Luckily we spotted the issue through our sun roof before the wheel fell out of the rack.  I would not recommend unless you only use it for short trips (<100 miles)
review.name: Forks Separate

review.reviewBody:
I was always struggling to fit my front wheel in the trunk (particularly true with 3 bikes), and this wheel holder is simply stunning! Easy to install (no tools required), compact (foldable) and secure (locks), it is a great addition! strongly recommend!
And shipping was blazing fast!
review.name: Easy installation, secure wheel perfectly!

Thank you for leaving the review on our Women's Montreal Coat Plus. We are really sorry that it did not fully meet your expectations on this occasion.

If you require our assistance, please contact us using our Contact Us form on the following website: https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat so we can help you further. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9AM - 5PM EST.

Thank you!
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: I bought this in the silver as a fun ski jacket. It is VERY warm- perfect for cold days! Also very waterproof. The hood fits well over a helmet. The cropped fit works great with bib style snow pants but also looks great with jeans as a non-ski jacket. I sized up to a large to accommodate sweaters etc underneath. Would buy again!
review.name: Super cute & warm

review.reviewBody: I had to order this jacket THREE times from Backcountry.  The first time, there was a rip in the jacket. The second time, they sent me the wrong jacket. The third time, they sent me back the jacket with the rip in it after I verified that Backcountry takes damaged items out of stock. Their compensation for these problems was absolutely pitiful. They didn’t care that their mistakes took away my time and energy. I just have to send it back for the third time and move on. Careful buying from them, they clearly put damaged items back in stock.
review.name: Sent me back a damaged item
comment: We regret the issues you experienced with your jacket order and understand your frustration. We have sent you an email to discuss this further.

name: Jordy Down Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: This vest looks great on my teen daughter. I think I’ll borrow it! It is comfortable and warm yet fashionable for our MI winters.
review.name: Great looking vest

review.reviewBody: This vest gets three stars because it keeps me warm and looks cool, but the stiff collar sticks into my neck the whole time I'm wearing it. I try to angle it out of the way a bit, but it doesn't work. So at least for me (5'4, xs), it's not comfortable enough.
review.name: Warm but not perfect

review.reviewBody: This vest is lightweight, but warm. It can be worn under a jacket with out being too bulky. The color is beautiful.
review.name: Love the color!

review.reviewBody: Staple in my wardrobe. Especially in this Iowa weather
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: Appears to be great but is a Christmas present for the kids.
review.name: Kids will love it

review.reviewBody: Love the color of this vest. It runs true to size. I wear a medium and the fit is perfect. The zipper pockets are great feature as well
review.name: Color is just one of the many great features of this vest

review.reviewBody: Love the vest however hate the collar, it's way too high and rubs under my chin making it very uncomfortable. The collar does not fold down well so I use baby pins to hold it down.  I have room to wear a hoodie or sweater underneath as I ordered the small. If things rubbing underneath your chin don't bother you then order this vest.
review.name: High collar

review.reviewBody: Fits as expected. Great material. I can have a sweatshirt on and still am able to zip the vest up.
review.name: I would buy this again!

review.reviewBody: I love this vest, I get tons of compliments when wearing it. It fits very nicely and just the perfect weight for the cool AZ mornings and nights.
review.name: I would definitely buy this in other colors!

review.reviewBody: It is a substantial vest, will definitely keep me warm when cold weather arrives. It is an off white color and the fabric is awesome to the touch, it"s like creamy! Pockets on inside to keep the phone warm! Absolutely beautifully made. Will love for years to come.
review.name: Definitely would buy this vest again!!

description: Buy the Black Diamond Offset Trim Tool online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Offset Trim Tool
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Offset Trim Tool online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Way better than the complimentary tool that comes with the skins
review.name: Better

review.reviewBody: If you are scared of cutting your own skins, let me tell you - this should give you the courage to DIY. Just put the skins on your skis and hold this firmly against the sidewall and voila, your skins are cut with just the right amount of edge showing.
review.name: Just do it

review.reviewBody: Shipped fast as listed. Easy to use, a+. What more would you want? Would buy... Will buy again.
review.name: Skins and trim tool

review.reviewBody:
I was a little concerned that there was hardly any reviews and no “How to” videos on the Internet, showing use of this tool. After all, this was my first skin trimming project. It was for my wife’s touring set up. Needless to say, I didn’t want to screw it up. The set of skins is not cheap now days.

But my worries quickly went away as soon as I made my first cut. I went slow and steady, as was recommended by the pros using other tools. I must say, I was extremely happy with the result!

The best thing about this tool is, I did not have to offset the skins to make the cuts. That made the project extremely easy and quick. My cuts turned out to be smooth and precise. I did have to trim very short portions of the skins at the beginning and the end of the cut with a sharp knife.

In conclusion, I’m sure some purists will say that the old way of cutting skins is the best, but for someone like me, who’s not doing this a lot, but has a general understanding of how things should work, this tool performed exactly as it should!
review.name: Works like a charm!

review.reviewBody: Better than the last trim tool! No need to offset the skins to cut. Way to improve this BD!
review.name: New and Improved

review.reviewBody: The new skin cutter is not intuitive and difficult to use. Why change a design that works? Guess BD likes breaking things…
review.name: You fixed something that wasn’t broke

name: Offset Trim Tool

review.itemreviewed: Booker Ultra Western Boot Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: Odd sizing compared to other styles from Ariat. Normally where a 11 EE but with these a 10 EE fits the same. Finish is nice and very comfortable out of the box
review.name: Odd sizing but comfortable
comment: Thank you for your feedback on this boot.  We so appreciate you taking the time to leave a review.  Please contact info@ariat.com or give us a call at 1-877-702-7428  if you need further assistance in this matter.

review.itemreviewed: Booker Ultra Western Boot Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: They run one size bigger than others if you’re 12 get and 11
review.name: Size

review.itemreviewed: Booker Ultra Western Boot Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: I needed a classy/sophisticated boot that was also durable enough for jobsite visits. I found it in this boot! There are only two reasons I didn’t arrive at a five star; first I had to return my first pair and go down a size which wasn’t reflected in the product description, the second being that I’ve only had them for a month. All and all a great product. I’m looking to purchase the hybrid low bow and the Booker as well. I like the Chelsea style. I’ve owned some Ariat cowboy boots in the past. Although I think the boots were a superior product, I didn’t like the full height because the top seam would rub my calf. Thank you for making quality genuine leather boots at affordable prices!
review.name: Just what I was looking for!

review.itemreviewed: Booker Ultra Western Boot Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great looking boot, I could have used a half size smaller than what I usually wear but the feel is great. Very happy with both pairs that I bought.
review.name: Boots

review.itemreviewed: Booker Ultra Western Boot Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: Super comfortable like all Ariats.  They work well with my more modern cut slimmer dress pants.
review.name: Great dress boots for slim pants.

review.itemreviewed: Booker Ultra Western Boot Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: One star because they shortly started coming apart from the soles. Mostly wearing to town so not many hard miles….
review.name: Nice looking
comment: We are sorry that these boots did not stack up and we appreciate this feedback. At Ariat we strive to deliver quality craftsmanship in all our products. Look out for an email from us where we can further discuss this issue. We’re here to help!

review.itemreviewed: Booker Ultra Western Boot Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: This western boot was exceptionally made and so comfortable out of the box. I am very impressed! Congrats to Ariat!!
review.name: This western boot

review.itemreviewed: Booker Ultra Western Boot Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: Just love these boots! The size is absolutely "True to Fit", and I enjoy the fact that they're light in weight. They're high quality leather, and comfortable right out the box. No breaking in was necessary. I highly recommend them.
review.name: Very Comfortable Boot

review.itemreviewed: Booker Ultra Western Boot Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’ve only had these boots for a few weeks but so far I love them! These are my first cowboy style boots that I’ve owned, but they are so comfortable and I’m glad there is a wide version available. I originally bought them as a “dress shoe,” but you can also wear them casually. I did put leather conditioner (bees wax) on them, which did darken them a bit, but they are still nice and classy. I purchased them in size 10.5 wide but usually wear a size 12 running shoe.
review.name: Very Comfortable and Stylish

review.itemreviewed: Booker Ultra Western Boot Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: Muy buen producto entrega súper rápido muy liviano
review.name: Botas

name: Booker Ultra Western Boot Wide - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Hike Light Cushion Low Ankle Sock
review.reviewBody: Have been using Darn Tough and Balega socks for a few years, and although I really love both of those brands, these Smarwool socks seem to work a little better for me.  I have some nerve damage in my right front and these don't seem to agitate it as much as the other brands.  I use them for hiking and day to day activity.
review.name: Love These Socks!

review.itemreviewed: Hike Light Cushion Low Ankle Sock
review.reviewBody: These socks are awesome.  My feet, literally, do not sweat in them.  They fit great and do not smell while wearing them.  They are nice and soft when wearing them and do not cause blistering.  I really recommend them.
review.name: Awesome socks

review.itemreviewed: Hike Light Cushion Low Ankle Sock
review.reviewBody: I've been wearing these socks casually. The cushion adds comfort while the wool gives them some added warmth. I'm a size 9 and the fit is perfect. No pills is also a plus.
review.name: Extraordinary Socks

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great jacket though haven’t been able to field test yet. Got an L and an XL and kept XL (I’m 5’10 182lbs athletic build) as the L was slightly snug in the midsection. Will pair with the Stony Shell jacket for skiing
review.name: Super comfy and sharp looking!

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I have now used this jacket for multiple ice climbing days, some hiking, and just walking to and from work. I am extremely happy with it. It is warm enough to wear in very cold temps (layered underneath), or on top of one layer for a hike in mid 30 degree Fahrenheit temps. 
The only thing is, I am 5'9", 170 lbs, and the Large is a bit snug, especially with the layers underneath. 
But, overall, I would highly recommend this jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This jacket is amazing. Very high quality, excellent fit (I'm 6,0 and 205 pounds and bought a Large). I will wear this with just a t shirt under out and about, and have even layered it under my Snowboard Jacket for extra warmth on super cold days. No more getting cold on the chairlift with this bad boy on!
review.name: Warm and comfortable!

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Super manteau! L√©ger, confortable et coupe parfaite

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, well made and incredibly warm! Skiing and fly fishing

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This is a wonderful coat to use as a layer or by itself.  I had a pervious version of this coat for the last 4-5 years and it never disappoints!  

One thing I noticed in this slight redesign, is it is a little bit slimmer around the underarms/rib cage.  It probably will be more streamlined as a layer now.  

I wore my last one so much I'm excited to have a refresh!  It had great durability, I just wore it that much!
review.name: Great Jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love it- I wish I had not gotten a hole in the pocket so quick, but that's easily looked past because of fit, function, and comfort.
review.name: Fantastic lightweight technical puffy

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very good quality, wore this on Whitney during the off season

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I wish I had gotten the correct size but these run a little small.

The warmth was all there. I also enjoyed the color scheme as well.

I'm normally an XL when it comes to size, so I bought an XL jacket. It was just a tad small though. For reference, I'm 6'4", about 215 lbs. And it was tight around the armpits/ shoulders.
review.name: Cool jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very light, very packable yet warm. Used hiking and day to day winter wear.

name: Eigerjoch Advanced IN Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Tecton X 3 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shoes were so comfortable right out of the box. I was really intrigued by the gaiter because I tend to get quite a few pebbles in my shoes on my long runs on our local trails. No more stopping to clean out my shoes! The gaiter is super functional, but also makes the shoe so comfortable. It hugs the foot well without being tight. This eliminates the need for a runner's knot or lace bite from having to really cinch down the laces. The shoe seems stable on the steep and technical trails and really wants to cruise on the flowy single track. In addition to the carbon plate making the miles go by faster and easier, it acts like a rock plate, dampening the force of landing on sharp, pointed rocks and roots. Overall, I couldn't be happier with this purchase.
review.name: Comfort meets function

review.itemreviewed: Tecton X 3 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The gaiter is unnecessary overkill and the upper rubbed my heels raw like no other shoe ever has. I loved the Tecton x2 but they ruined it with this version. Wouldn't buy this shoe again at any price.
review.name: Awful

review.itemreviewed: Tecton X 3 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was initially very happy with the shoes, but upon closer inspection, I noticed a defect in the ankle sleeve. Given that I paid nearly $300, I expect the product to arrive in perfect condition. I'm now considering returning them and would appreciate your assistance in resolving this issue.
review.name: Defective Product Received: Seeking Assistance

review.itemreviewed: Tecton X 3 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have a ton of Hoka shoes including the Tecton x2. Totally different feel. Legs, feet, knees love these shoes on rock and asphalt mix roads. Great job.
review.name: Love this shoe

review.itemreviewed: Tecton X 3 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: If you move quickly on the trails, descending with aggression, and enjoy hammering the flats, this shoe is for you. The slower, heavier runner will not benefit from this high performance shoe... it lacks stability and will break down much faster. This shoes hikes really well. Some carbon models do not. An obvious plus for the trail runner. It's very light. The gaiter is functional. It climbs ridiculously well. I'm a consistent 10.5 in Hoka (Mafate speed, SPEEDGOAT, cielo, etc.). Wider, and higher toe box than the SPEEDGOAT 5.
review.name: For the pure runner (fast, light, efficient)

review.itemreviewed: Tecton X 3 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was reluctant to buy them based on the price but after trying them on and doing a quick test run I was sold. I only have 30 miles so far but this shoe feeling awesome. The fit is spot on, the midsole is incredible feeling at a variety of paces. The only issue I have is with the gaiter. the gaiter itself is super comfortable and I don't really notice it, however the seam, that runs along the Achilles is causing some rubbing on one of feet, to the point that I'm probably going to have to tape it on longer runs to prevent blistering. . I think it's more my shoe and not inherent to the line itself. The seam it's self and the rest of the gaiter are very soft and comfortable but where seam is glued together is a little stiffer and it has crinkled ever so slightly and in just the right way to cause the rubbing. That being said, It won't prevent me from continuing to run in this shoe, this is probably the most comfortable and fun trail shoe I've run in to date
review.name: Fantastic ride

review.itemreviewed: Tecton X 3 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Just as the headline states, I bought these, they arrived on Tuesday, and my first run with them was that Saturday (today), and I ran my first 50k in shoes I had never run in before. I know, but I had a feeling they would work, and I went with my gut. I was rewarded. I had worn the Zegama 2 for all my training and planned to wear those for the race, but I wanted something lighter and with a plate, and these came out at the right time (especially the black and blue colorway!). They were a welcome roomier fit than the Zegama 2 also. Midsole was plenty soft and responsive, and the gator simply works 100%. No hot spots, wore my usual size and they fit great. It was a perfect experience. What I would warn potential buyers of is the soft toe-guard. Again, this was my first 50k, and the declines were steep and jam-packed with raquetball-sized rocks. A trip on one occasion, and the kick-up of a rock by one foot, which was subsequently punted by my other foot, smashed my big toe. The inexperience and sloppy running couldn't be blamed on the shoe of course, but the protection wasn't there to save my inexperienced and sloppy late-race running. Honestly though, more robust toe-guards could potentially catch the long toe, and that is a deal-breaker in my opinion, so I prefer the softer toe-guard. Just have to be careful. Bottom line, this shoe worked instantly for me out of the box, and it was an amazing run. Even in the final 10k of the 50k, I was still being taken care of by the shoe, with my legs saved, and my foot soles appreciating the protective and responsive midsole and split carbon plate. This has to be the best, if not top 3, trail shoes of the year. I have a feeling this will be a legendary shoe. You will be thrilled. They're worth it.
review.name: Out of the box, First 50k, First run.

review.itemreviewed: Tecton X 3 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was reluctant to buy them based on the price but after trying them on and doing a quick test run I was sold. I only have 30 miles so far but this shoe feeling awesome. The fit is spot on, the midsole is incredible feeling at a variety of paces. The only issue I have is with the gaiter. the gaiter itself is super comfortable and I don't really notice it, however the seam, that runs along the Achilles is causing some rubbing on one of feet, to the point that I'm probably going to have to tape it on longer runs to prevent blistering. . I think it's more my shoe and not inherent to the line itself. The seam it's self and the rest of the gaiter are very soft and comfortable but where seam is glued together is a little stiffer and it has crinkled ever so slightly and in just the right way to cause the rubbing. That being said, It won't prevent me from continuing to run in this shoe, this is probably the most comfortable and fun trail shoe I've run in to date
review.name: Most comfortable trail shoe

review.itemreviewed: Tecton X 3 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've had and still have many good-to-great trail shoes, but the Tecton X 3 really takes things to the next level for trail running. I'm not an ultra runner and usually run in between 10~20 miles about 3 times per week around the trails in my very hilly neighborhood. So, yes, I do run the trails quite a lot although not ultra distances in one-go. But now that I have the Tecton X 3, I'm going to give 50K a shot soon and then go from there. This shoe is a pure joy to run in. I've got around 70 miles over 5 runs in this shoe in little over a week and each run felt better as the upper molds to my feet and the foam/plate in the midsole break in. It's bouncy and propulsive but still very comfortable underfoot and, most surprisingly, very stable - even on very uneven and mildly technical trails. I'm in SoCal, so the trails are mostly smoothened dirt/gravel with rolling hills, so I haven't tested it on steep and rocky mountain trails yet. It's probably not the best for such terrains due to the stack height, but it should be okay. For relatively flat desert-like trails (West Coast), this shoe is a dream. The bounce and the propulsion coming from the PEBA foam and plate in the forefoot really makes hill climbs much easier and more fun and the extra foam on the heel along with the superb grip of the Vibram Litebase outsole makes the downhill runs exhilaratingly fun. And the comfort underfoot is just amazing. Even after a 15-mile run, I feel like I've only gotten started in terms of comfort. The fit is a bit roomier than I expected and took me a little while to dial in with the right thickness socks and lacing, but I'd say it's true to size. It felt a bit narrow on the side of the forefoot area although the toe-box is roomy enough for the toes to splay. Loosening the lacing a bit in that area while tightening more in the toe-box and the ankle/heel have fixed the issue and I don't experience any hot spots anymore. Overall, an amazing trail shoe and I'm extremely happy with it.
review.name: Best and Most Fun Trail Shoe I've Ever Ran In

review.itemreviewed: Tecton X 3 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I ran a 50K with this shoe right out of the box. I had my backup shoes available if any issues. No issues at all. I love them.
review.name: Most comfortable shoe ever

name: Tecton X 3 Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots are very stiff and really hurt my calves. They do not bend when walking I sitting down. Quite disappointing.
review.name: Disappointed

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These fit perfectly and are very comfortable. I usually take a size 10, I was recommended go up 1/2 a size and not too big. Haven't used outside yet. Super happy with the fit.
review.name: Love these boots

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Love these boots!

I was a little hesitant in ordering these boots after reading some of the reviews. I have a high arch and have never purchased a zip ankle boots.  I was worried after reading the reviews that I would have trouble getting them on. I have been buying Merrell winter boots and hiking shoes for years and have never been disappointed so I took the chance.  These are now my favourite boots. I just love them!!!  I’ve had no problems getting them on nor zipper issues.  They are extremely comfortable, very well made and look great. I ordered them on a Tuesday around 5:30 pm and they were delivered early Thursday afternoon. What more could I ask for?  Thanks again Merrell for making a quality pair of boots.
review.name: Love these boots!
comment: Thanks Sheila! We're happy you love them!

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased both the size 9 and 9.5 and neither fit even when using thin socks and a plastic bag on my foot to reduce friction.   Need to try size 10 but no longer in stock.   Am returning today.   Otherwise they appear to be an attractive walking boot but unsuitable for someone with a high instep.
review.name: Didn't fit

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I think this is a great boot, but it has a serious design flaw that makes it super difficult to put them on. The feet get stuck and it always takes me a lot of effort to get them in. Otherwise it's good - it has kept my feet warm and dry.
review.name: Hard to put on

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: They were just delivered and they are terrific.  Great soles as one finds on hiking boots.  Comfortable, easy to put on and they look nice.  Delivered in a timely fashion.
review.name: Great boots
comment: We're grateful for your input.

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I love these boots. It is on the bigger size. I ordered 9.5, feels almost like a 10. But I can fit my winter socks in, so I like that.
Very warm and water proof.
I don't have any of the issues other had.. it fits on,my ankle perfectly, zipper is ok as well.
review.name: So far so good, that I love it
comment: We're happy you love them! Thanks for sharing!

name: Coldpack 3 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great everyday shirt in cool or hot weather. I find myself wearing long sleeve shirts more and more as I get older to avoid sun. And this feels and wears good.
review.name: Feels great

review.reviewBody: Bought this from Backcountry and another brand from the other company.  This one is very comfortable and my wife says it looks great.  I live in SoCal and am a rock climber so I've intentionally switched shirts in the middle of the day/session to see which keeps me cooler - not this one.  I now wear this one if I'm out in the morning or evening and want to protect my tattoos from some sunlight.  I wear the other one if I'm out in the middle of the day and want to stay cooler.  This one certainly protects from the sun and feels good; but, it's hot.
review.name: Good - not as cool as competition

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a nice garment, seams are in the right places, fit is snug, but not restricting. I am 5' 10" and 187 lbs, I have the large, and am satisfied with my size choice.  Wearing sunscreen is a personal decision, I am never sure if I have applied thoroughly and covered exposed areas.  I like the idea of throwing on a shirt and feeling confident.  Honestly, my wife laughed at me when I put on the hood and observed my "turtle head" effect, but when I reminded her that it was an easy way to cover up my balding head and ears, she was all in.  Speaking of the hood, it is cut low enough to cover most of my forehead and brow.  Cool and breathable, thumb loops are optional and stay concealed and non-irritating when not deployed.  Again, well-constructed, and I am pleased with the color, a kind of light mint green blend.
review.name: Nice Garment

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is easily one of my favorite shirts. It feels soft to the skin, comfortable, and lightweight. I can also feel the breeze through this shirt making it breathable. Sizing is true and I went with a large. Just wish it was a tad longer. The fitting is closer to the body than the Terminal Tackle hoodie. I will see how this washes in the laundry machine.
review.name: Lightweight and soft

review.reviewBody: Great shirt, great fit as advertised. Lightweight material.
review.name: PFG is great.

review.reviewBody: This has become one of my favorite summer shirts. Not having to get slathered up with sun screen is such a great thing. The shirt is soft, breathable, and fits really well. It blocks the sun as advertised and it dries quickly. I bought two because I like it so much. For sizing, I am 6'2" about 178 lbs athletic build and it fits perfect. The shirt is long enough in all areas without being too wide and baggy. I will not run this through the dyer to keep the size as is. Needless to say, I recommend this shirt 100%. You will be happy you went for it!
review.name: Soft, breathable, and fits extremely well!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a good shirt for working outside on a hot Texas day. Like that it provides protection from the sun and I can put the hood on for my neck. Haven’t gotten to use it fishing yet but hopefully soon! The XL is a little smaller than my other TShirts but still fits fine.
review.name: Great shirt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good fit, more athletic sizing for ease of movement, not as bulky as some similar shirts
review.name: GREAT FISHING SHIRT!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great Hoodie - Pattern is awesome and fabric is buttery soft.
review.name: Awesome Hoodie

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable breathable and the hoodie is awesome
review.name: Columbia is a very awesome company

name: PFG Uncharted Hoodie - Men's

For these reasons,  I returned the gloves. I liked how they felt on the inside and that they were not bulky.

comment: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We appreciate you as a Columbia customer and your feedback is what helps us improve.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These gloves were such a disappointment. They over priced what they are and if you are wanting to keep your hands warm in temps below 60 F don't bother.
review.name: Not worth it
comment: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We appreciate you as a Columbia customer and your feedback is what helps us improve. Please reach out if you need further assistance.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I frequently use this product, and it is particularly suitable for the winter season. I would consider gifting it to someone.
review.name: Perfect for winter!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These gloves came just in time for all the snow that arrived right after Thanksgiving. They keep my hands dry and warm. They are a tiny bit snug slipping on, but not a problem after they're on.They have been great w/ all the shoveling going on here.
review.name: So thankful to have these

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Usually, I love Columbia Products.   My husband have had loved the wonderful omni-heat products for jackets and base-layers but these gloves were a real disappointment.  My fingers hurt in these gloves in the cold weather.  I had hoped for more warmth.
review.name: Doesn't Provide Warmth as Expected
comment: Thank you for bringing this to our attention.  Please know that we are committed to improvement and If you'd like to discuss your concerns further, please reach out to us directly.

description: Buy the Camp Chef Mountaineer Aluminum Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mountaineer Aluminum Stove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Camp Chef Mountaineer Aluminum Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Follow up to my earlier review. I wrote that you can use a 12” skillet and 6 to 8” skillet at the same time but, you can go bigger. The problem is the windscreen wings aren’t adjustable where they attach to the base of the stove ( like the Coleman gas camp stoves) and depending on pan size you may have no windscreen protection. 
It’s not a deal breaker but, having two different pan sizes can help.
Very good performing and well built stove.
review.name: Alpine II

review.reviewBody: Camped on a lake bluff with storms for three days and this stove never once so much as flickered during high winds.  Great for pancakes and coffee.  Well made.  Go for it.
review.name: High wind dominator!

review.reviewBody:
Pros:

The 20,000 btu per burner was what sets it apart for me. I won't be using that much most of the time, but it's great to know I can boil water really fast when you need to. 

It's light for it's size due to the aluminum. 

It has good build quality and looks like a very nice stove.

The ability to set the flame ultra low or extra high give me so much control. Less worry about burning my food at camp.


Cons:
The lid isn't held down tightly by the clamps, so if you have it standing up in your vehicle, it makes clanking sounds. 

The edges are a little rough and can cut you. If it's a concern, just use tape off the sides and sand the edges down a bit. Not the end of the world.

The large size also means that it isn't compact and you need space to bring a 5lb,10lb, or 20lb propane with you since the 1lb one don't seem give it enough pressure to run the stove well.
review.name: Quality build, highest BTU output

review.reviewBody: Heavy duty construction, very pleased with it. I love the windshields on the sides and how they lock in place.
review.name: Mountaineer - Aluminum

review.reviewBody: Long time Camper, restaurant veteran.  Using stove for first time on current trip.  Seems very sturdy and well made.  Excellent temp control from low to big heat output.  Each burners independently controlled and put out full heat range.  Easy to clean.  It is pretty large, will accommodate larger pans or griddle.  Waited a long time for stove to be in stock, disappointed that legs remain out of stock.
review.name: Very happy, so far

review.reviewBody:
This Mountaineer is well built and sturdily constructed, it should last forever. It folds up and latches closed and the gas hose can be stored inside.  When it's set up for use, the side flaps fasten in place and keep the wind off the burners.  
Two issues prevent me from giving it 5 stars.  
First, it gets insanely hot.  Seriously, who needs a 20, 000 BTU burner on a camp stove?  It would make more sense to have a burner that can get down to a true simmer.
Second, the gas hose supply would be more practical if there were a convenient extension hose available.  As it is, it cannot be directly connected to an RV outlet.
review.name: Well Designed and Well Constructed

review.reviewBody: I received a recommendation for a Camp Chef Mountaineer from my brother. I couldn't be happier with this piece of camp equipment. It makes cooking a breeze! It's super portable and has a really sturdy construction. We took it out for it's inaugural trip in the woods and it performed so well. When boiling water, you can really tell how much heat it puts out. Easy to control. Simple and sleek aluminum construction. I highly recommend!
review.name: Built Well, Hot As Can Be

review.reviewBody: Gave this five stars because I like it so much. Great combination of how rugged something can be, and still be lite enough to want to take with you. Also good corrosion resistance.  Be carefull of the gas connector which is on the bottom if you carry it by the handle. If you set it down in dirt or sand it can clog the gas orifices. Cap it with a piece of plastic bag and rubber band during transport.
review.name: Mountaineer Aluminum MS40AX

name: Mountaineer Aluminum Stove

description: Buy the Black Diamond Snow Saw Pro online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Snow Saw Pro
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Snow Saw Pro online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Works just fine. Could use multi purpose teeth to enable cutting of wood as well.
review.name: Fine

review.reviewBody: Really great how it folds into the handle instead of a separate sheath. Handle rotates and locks at several angles making it easy to use.
review.name: Solid snow saw

review.reviewBody: Little bit of play in the blade/handle interface, but not much. locking mechanism feels super solid, as does handle/sheath. big button, easy to press with gloves.
review.name: Feels solid!

review.reviewBody: Excellent addition to my backcountry pack. This blade is razor sharp and light weight. I have yet to try the pole attachments yet
review.name: Sharp, durable, light weight

review.reviewBody: It had all the versatility I needed and was at the right price point. Highly recommend .
review.name: Great saw used in the baker back country

review.reviewBody: I’d say the best feature of this saw is the folding action. The blade is easy to stash in a backpack when folded without concern for an exposed blade cutting other items. The easy attachment to a BD trekking pole is excellent for extending the saw for ECTs or long cuts.  Very easy and quite stable for an extension. A couple detractors: the position locking button for saw sticks out and easily gets jammed with snow and ice if cutting deeper than the blade, like when cutting ECT columns, and the blade flexes a bit more than desired. Slower, more careful cutting can give a straighter cut with this blade.

I have quite a few snow saws as I run an Avalanche Education Program and and Avalanche Forecast Center.  I have a 100cm Brooks Range Saw that I wanted to replace to lighten my load.  This saw was to fit that bill.  The saw works great and attached to my adjustable poles nicely; however, the folding mechanism tends to fill with snow and ice and freeze up.  I can usually fix this by blowing hot air in the joint area or pooring a hot liquid.  This more annoying than anything else as it can take up to a few minutes before I can collapse.
review.name: Nice Saw - Icing Issues on mechanism

review.reviewBody: Great saw for snow, nothing else. Too flimsy for even the smallest of branches from fallen trees.
review.name: Good Saw

review.reviewBody: Good blade, locks at 90 deg to saw back side of block, stows nicely inside of handle

While I haven't used this much, I really like the idea of being able to use a pole to extend the saw.  I imagine this will make cutting cornices and other weirdness much easier.  Works great with the Traverse WR2 and WR3 poles.
review.name: Ingenious design that works with most poles

name: Snow Saw Pro

review.reviewBody: Tried Kuhl lightweight hoodie. No comparison in Quality. I have a 10 year old Free Fly I use for workout and yard work.

review.reviewBody: These are my husband’s favorite light-weight sun hoodies. Great for all outdoor activities. He also loves to travel in them bc they are so soft.
review.name: My husband loves these!

review.reviewBody: Great hoodie. The hood stays tight even when on plane
review.name: Great fishing hoodie

review.reviewBody: This is my third one. They fit great and work well to keep you from overheating on a sunny day, while doing enough to protect from the elements when it’s cool out.
review.name: Love these hoodies

review.reviewBody: The Bamboo Lightweight Hoodie is perfect for winter layering. It is true to size is well constructed and because it is lightweight it willfit perfectly under my hesvier layers.
review.name: A great layering accessory

review.reviewBody: Men's Bamboo Lightweight Hoodie - Blue Fog Fit was excellent and material is very comfortable.
review.name: Men's Bamboo Lightweight Hoodie - Blue Fog

review.reviewBody: My husband wears this for outdoor activities in warmer weather. No sunscreen needed yet it is light enough for hot weather.
review.name: comfy and light

review.reviewBody: Just purchased my 2nd Hoodie. This is a great casual top to wear most anywhere. Pairs great with the their Breeze pants. Sharp look with a ton of great colors to pick from. Won’t be my last purchase.
review.name: Men’s Bamboo Lightweight Hoodie.

review.reviewBody: These shirts are incredibly comfortable. Unfortunately, they are not durable. After two light uses (running errands), it is already fraying and pilling around the cuffs and elbow areas. I haven't even put these shirts through the rigors of outdoor use yet. For this price point, I'm disappointed. I can't recommend purchasing the lightweight hoodie.I have the more robust Flex Hoodie that has a higher fabric weight. It has held up well but is not appropriate for warm weather.
review.name: Comfortable but not durable

description: Buy the Ariat Spitfire Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Spitfire Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ariat Spitfire Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I ordered these for work and have worn them every day for over six months. They were comfortable out of the box. They still look great and have held up well. The insoles have broken down but considering I work long days and am on my feet all day long that's understandable. I am ordering my second pair and maybe another to wear around town!
review.name: Very Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Excellent fit, look great, sturdy. Love these!!!!!!!
review.name: So comfortable

review.reviewBody: If you work at an establishment where steel toe shoes aren’t a requirement, but you still want a shoe that will give you ample protection and comfort while still being durable then this is the shoe for you. The Ariat Spitfire is lightweight and more comfortable than other moccasin style shoes on the market.
review.name: Lightweight shoe

review.reviewBody:
These shoes fit great and are my new everyday wear for day in the office. They are super easy to slip on and off and cushion every step really well! The professional look is great especially considering they're slip-ons! They hold up surprisingly well against water when I've had to trek through the puddles in the parking lot. socks stayed dry in water covering my toes! 
My only complaint is they get real slick with wet soles on tile or smooth surfaces.
review.name: Comfortable Office Shoes!

review.reviewBody: Because I wear these shoes standing all day and do not get back pain.  This is a big plus for those of us on our feet 10 hours a day.  Would recommend for anyone having back issues. Thank you Ariat for creating these shoes, keep them coming.  I will continue to buy them and for all occasions.
review.name: Awesome walking shoe

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these shoes to give my feet a break from boots, but since I'm not used to lace ups I end up loosening the laces as far as I can by the end of the day as my feet must swell up, resulting in them feeling tight. I still love them and wear them often. They have held up really well too and are easy to clean
review.name: Super comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are comfortable and wear well to work in shop and out helping on cattle farm.
review.name: Comfortable comfortable fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I usually wear a size 7 and they run big I got a 6.5 and still lose o would go down a whole size to a 6 . Other than that they comfortable love them! I’m a Ariat junkie
review.name: Very comfortable

review.name: Most comfortable show I’ve ever worn.

review.reviewBody: Great
review.name: Great light outdoor shoe

review.reviewBody: I am enjoying these shoes quite a bit so far, the only issue I have is with the tongue causing some discomfort because of the design.
review.name: Good stiff, hiking shoe

review.reviewBody: Love these shoes. I wear them everyday and have for the past year and a half. They have held up great. The tread is fantastic and very grippy, but more on the softer side so they will wear a bit faster if you are mainly walking on pavement or sidewalks. They are very light and breath well and are incredibly comfortable. The included insole adjustment options are a really nice touch. Highly recommended!
review.name: Excellent Shoes!

review.reviewBody: Fantastic day-hike shoe. Does ok on rocky trails as well, but you do lots of it you will need a stiffer sole. Runs a little small so do order 1/2 size up especially if you will put your own orthopedic sole in it.
review.name: Fantastic everyday to day-hike shoe. Order 1/2 size up

review.reviewBody: Brand new, they fit my foot like a glove. Have to get used to the forward lean, little different than Salomons flat foot feel.  Really lightweight for a shoe. Laces are smaller than most shoelaces, feel like climbing accessory rope instead of common shoelaces.  Soles grip like glue on rocks.  Really like how these hug your feet and feel like they become part of your feet.  Minimalist hike shoe, but pack a lot of comfort, grip and flex where needed, solid where flex is not needed.  The heel pockets itself like custom Madd shoes.  Everybody's foot is different, I think I have what are considered Roman-toed feet and these work perfect for my feet.
review.name: Fit like a glove, comes with insert options.

review.reviewBody: Great fit, comfortable for everyday wear or technical use.
Comfort and quality. I’ve used these shoes on the daily basis as well as extended hikes

I have been wearing various salewa shoes for the past five years and these are hands down my favorite pair. They are very comfortably, little to no break in period, breath very well and the soft sole allows for great traction. Only downside, the soft sole does cause it to wear faster. I will be ordering again!
review.name: Great all around shoe

review.reviewBody: excellent fit and comfort.

review.reviewBody: This was purchased as a gift for my son in September.  My husband has worn Kuhl for years. The brand has always held up well and maintained a great balance between form and function.  Unfortunately, this jacket was a disappointment from day one.  It arrived feeling stiff, synthetic, and frankly, cheap.  A wash and brief tumble with dryer balls seemed to help some. But now it is pilling all over and I've needed to use a sweater shaver on it multiple times over the past two months.  Really disappointing from a company that has always held up well.

review.reviewBody: I've been trying to find a merino beanie that would fit under my bike helmet well for some extra warmth on cold rides.  I thought this would sit on my head well without folding or cuffing the beanie.  It did not, it came down too low, basically covering my eyes, unless I folded it over, which would make it not fit under my helmet.  It was also too tight on my head, making it uncomfortable.  I returned it due to these reasons.  Wish it was a bit less tall, and fit a little looser because it's nice looking hat otherwise, and merino wool is not paper thin like a lot of other merino beanies out there.  It also took like 2 weeks to arrive, and I'm still waiting on my refund a week so after sending it.
review.name: Too tall without cuffing, too snug
