review.itemreviewed: Terradora Flex Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have 9 pairs of Keens. I wear the sandals and casual shoes. My feet love the fit. For some reason the arch support in the Terradora feels like it sits closer to the heel than the other shoes. It’s too uncomfortable so I need to return.
review.name: Arch support placement

review.itemreviewed: Terradora Flex Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The toe box could be a little wider and the shoelaces are really poor quality. Shoes are pretty comfortable but taking a bit to break in. Love the light weight of them!
review.name: Flex Waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Terradora Flex Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The shoe is great, comfortable, good support, waterproof & warm. I’m disappointed in the laces - cheap, flimsy, too long. I use shoe for walking everyday & easy trail hikes. If not for the laces a 5
review.name: Great Shoe subpar laces

review.itemreviewed: Terradora Flex Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am a big fan of Keen shoes and have several pairs. These shoes are comfortable on the foot, having a good fit, true to size and lacing up with good socks has them fitting my narrow feet very well. I have a pair of high top insulated walking shoes that I love but wanted a pair of low tops as my ankle was broken and the high tops rub on the scars. However, I do not like the sole on these shoes. I have worn them so I can’t return. The soles have hard ridges and so when I walk, it’s more of a “clomp”, making them noisier than my high-tops also. But the ridges feel hard against the ball of my foot when I walk. It’s hard to describe, and there doesn’t really look to be much difference in the design of my two pairs of walking shoes, but my high-tops are more comfortable to walk in. I will only buy walking shoes, Keen’s, in the future in store. I recommend only Keen’s to friends and will continue. The fit is perfect.
review.name: Love the fit, but not the sole

review.itemreviewed: Terradora Flex Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great shoes — comfortable and supportive of a narrow foot. I’ve been looking for something like this for years! They might not work so well for a normal medium width foot.
review.name: Perfect for a narrow foot

review.itemreviewed: Terradora Flex Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wanted to love these shoes, but sadly, didn’t. My left foot is slightly larger than my right, yet the right shoe was “short” on my second toe right foot. My big toe is actually bigger. By the end of the day, my foot felt cramped and sore. Sad. These are not inexpensive shoes. My first pair had to be returned due to improper stitching. I had to order a different shoe due to availability and I am disappointed.
review.name: Not a terrible experience.

review.itemreviewed: Terradora Flex Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: It is hard to find water proof light weight shoes and these do the trick. I use these to play disc golf where I can find myself off the trail in the forest, in the middle so tall wet grass, or in the rain. They are rugged enough to get around in wooded terrain but not too bulky. Love them.
review.name: Summertime Fun

review.itemreviewed: Terradora Flex Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Toe box was too narrow so toes can not spread naturally with each step. Otherwise comfortable.
review.name: Too narrow in toe box.

review.itemreviewed: Terradora Flex Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Toe box does not let toes spread naturally with each step. Heal fit was good.
review.name: Too narrow in toe box.

review.itemreviewed: Terradora Flex Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I felt very balanced and grounded. Love that it’s waterproof.
review.name: Sturdy shoe

name: Terradora Flex Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.name: Sherpa Mountain Series Table & Organizer

review.reviewBody: Purchased today and loaded with some basic supplies.  Seam at the zipper separated when we zipped it up.  disappointed it broke before even getting a night of camping in.
review.name: Broke before use
comment:
Hi SWMO CAMPER,

We believe in being a brand that stands by our products. We would like to appologize for for the inconvenience. Please reach out to support@campchef.com and we will see what we can do to make things right.

review.reviewBody: This thing is awesome. I’ve experimented with various totes, drawers built out in the truck bed, but everything always felt spread across too many places. The Sherpa keeps all of our family’s cookware, plates and utensils, coffee set up, clean up and some essentials like first aid kits all in one place. When the legs are extended the table is the same height as my folding table from Costco. It works great as a surface for the camp stove leaving my other table available for food prep. My only gripe is the zipper can be tough to get going. Overall an outstanding product.
review.name: As a guy with a man bun

review.reviewBody: I really like the product, it holds more stuff than it looks like it should. (I think its magic). I had a minor issue and contacted support thru the proper channels. They listened and quickly and satisfactorily resolved the issue. I also enjoy using my Camp Chef stove and carry bag. Well built equipment and responsive company. That is not often seen these day! Like common sense! Bravo Camp Chef.
review.name: Very handy product, outstanding support.

review.reviewBody: Just what I needed for a chuck box substitute. Organizing my kitchen gear while tent camping was my main goal in this purchase. I  organized my cooking gear into three of the individual color coordinating storage sacks inside. The fourth sack had more than enough room for a week's supply of freeze dried meals. The metal roll table top was sufficient in size to allow the use of my Camp Chef Ranger II stove on top.
review.name: Lighter and less bulky than a wooden chuck box

review.reviewBody: Item was received with poorly installed detents that did not have enough tension to hold up a empty table let alone one with equipment and a stove.  After adding tension to the detents the legs would hold up, barely.  Overall the Sherpa was bulky and did not really offer a feeling of quality capable of carrying much camping gear.  Serious campers should stay away.  Quality you would expect from something made in China.
review.name: Sherpa table made for guys with man buns

review.reviewBody: Fantastic idea for camping. Appears to be well constructed. Haven’t used it yet.
review.name: Sherpa table and organizer

review.reviewBody: I received this as a gift, as my wife and I are avid tent campers. This has allowed us to ditch all of the different bins and bags that we had to load/unload and search through when we hit the road. Excellent quality and very functional design. I do wish there was a separate compartment underneath for camp grill storage, but overall this is very versatile addition to our gear that makes camp life much easier!
review.name: Excellent Design!
The Sherpa turns heads

review.reviewBody: Bought one a couple of years ago and am very happy with it, very versatile and comparatively light-weight, excellent item.  I use it a lot and it is holding up very well.
review.name: excellent organizer for camping, great chuckbox

review.reviewBody: 7000 miles in 7 weeks in a Jeep on forest roads and 2 tracks this summer (2017).  Last 3000 miles on the Continental Divide from Mexico to Canada. So yes, I know this product well.  No limit to best uses, but ideal for boon docking in the wilderness. Lightweight, well constructed. Ample room to store cookware, dishware, lanterns, etc.  Easy to organize and find gear. No more digging through bins.  Pull it out of Jeep, extend legs- and camp is half set up.  Why 'almost perfect'? I'd pay more to have the following features: higher table height and I'm short; a bottom compartment that holds the Camp Chef stove AND adjustable leg heights for uneven surfaces.  If Super Sherpa comes on market I'll be first to buy.
review.name: Almost perfection.

name: Sherpa Mountain Series Table & Organizer

description: Buy the MSR Reactor 2.5 Pot online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Reactor 2.5 Pot
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Reactor 2.5 Pot online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Having this pot, and the smaller one, was a game changer for where we cook, what, and how. You can live with the one smaller Reactor pot - but the universe opens up with two ! Also, way prefer the sturdier handle on this larger pot than the smaller on.
review.name: Having this pot, and the

review.reviewBody:
I own all three sizes of the pot, they all have their own uses and are each pretty fantastic. The marked maximum fill for the 1.0L pot is 0.5L, and for the 1.7L pot the marked maximum is 1.0L, while the 2.5L pot lacks a maximum fill marking. I regularly push above the max on the two smaller sizes which I think is safe as long as the flame is low (which should be better for efficiency anyway) and just keep a close eye on everything - obviously do that at your own risk though.

 My biggest gripe is that the 1.0L could probably shed quite a bit of mass with just a few tweaks. While I like the thick walls of the pot, I'd be happy to have them slightly thinner which would trade some durability for lighter weight. Additionally, the handle is chunky at 17g, not including the cleat on the pot that the handle attaches to or the little ball + cable latch. Removing all that extra hardware from the pot could probably remove 25g total, and then users could either choose a cozy+fabric handle arrangement like the WindBurner 1.0L has or bring a pot lifter (there are commercially available pot lifters on the market that weigh less than 4g). Perhaps MSR could produce an additional pot for the reactor stove, like a 0.8L UL that had those changes? That would be an excellent upgrade to an already fantastic system
review.name: nice pot, could be slightly lighter

review.reviewBody:
The whole set works great. I just recently lost the lid and it is impossible to find a replacement. I don't want to repurchase the whole set since I'm missing the most inexpensive part of it.
I hope they can fix this soon so I can keep using their set
review.name: Lid replacement impossible to find

review.reviewBody: I love all of the tractor line cookware. Fastest heat hung and even cooking. Light too.
review.name: Reactor

review.reviewBody: This pot/stove combo is the best way I know to cook food for 3 people in the wilderness.
review.name: Cook for 3

review.reviewBody: The reactor stove has always been the best in my view. Quick boil times and I just looks amazing. I, like other reviewers would like to see a ceramic option for the pan as i don’t like cooking with aluminium. I’d love to see a Skillet option too.
review.name: Great stove

review.reviewBody: using it with Reactor set and other propane stoves
review.name: yes

review.reviewBody: By far the fastest stove for boiling water and comes with options on size of pot to fit the group.
review.name: Well worth the money

review.reviewBody: The reactor cooking system is fantastic. Boils fast and is easy to set up and use. Surprisingly it does not take much longer to boil water in the 2.5 liter pot over the 1 liter.
review.name: Expensive but worth it for the quick boil times!

review.reviewBody: I've had several reactors over the years and there's a reason I keep buying another when I need to replace one. I've always used the 1.7L pot and loved it. I do wish MSR would make a pot adapter(like Jetboil does) to cook with a frying pan(or other standard pot) on the Reactor. I keep checking back to see if they've made it yet... That would make the Reactor the ultimate one-burner stove kit.
review.name: Always a winner

name: Reactor 2.5 Pot

review.itemreviewed: Performance Hike Light Cushion Low Ankle Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love Low Ankle socks and Smartwool makes the best!  The cushioning is great and just the right amount.  I love how well Smartwool socks last.
review.name: Excellent hiking sock!

review.itemreviewed: Performance Hike Light Cushion Low Ankle Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Very cushy and comfortable 
I highly recommend this sock for hiking or casual wear
review.name: Love it!

review.itemreviewed: Performance Hike Light Cushion Low Ankle Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wow, I ordered and received 3 pairs womens L/G and there is a huge difference in sizing between them.   (See photo) Two pair seem more like a men’s size large and only one seems correct for women’s large.  I will have to return two of the three.  I wear a size 10 or 41 EU size
review.name: 3 different lengths in 3 women’s large

review.itemreviewed: Performance Hike Light Cushion Low Ankle Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: I generally love Smartwool socks. I have tons of them. These socks, however, are not lightweight. They are quite thick and make it nearly impossible for me to get my feet into my favorite hiking boots and waterproof trail runners. So basically they're rather useless, since they're low-ankle socks. They're too low to be worn in the winter but too thick to be useful in the summer.
review.name: Not-so-light cushioning

review.itemreviewed: Performance Hike Light Cushion Low Ankle Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: These socks are great.  They are very comfortable and stay in place all day.
review.name: smartwool cushioned socks for women

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got my first pairs of Ferrosi Shorts 6 years ago and they have only recently gotten to the point to where they beed to be replaced. I am enjoying my new ones.
review.name: Comfortable and durable shorts

review.reviewBody: I wear them everyday around town and when I go hiking.
review.name: Great Shorts

review.reviewBody: My husband cannot love these shorts more. We both have the pants and shorts and they are fantastic. True to size for him , comfortable and very quick drying. Would recommend!
review.name: Husband loves these!

review.reviewBody: Day to day use, also use for outdoor activity, very comfortable
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.reviewBody: Good fitting and just enough stretch to handle elevation changes comfortably. Stylish,good looking, and durable.
review.name: Awesome Shorts!

review.reviewBody: Excellent for everyday use, comfortable, just perfect, light, stretch
review.name: I recommend this product

review.reviewBody: Lightweight and great fit. I might wear these every day this summer...
review.name: Wish I had bought more than 1 pair

review.reviewBody: I purchased these on a whim as I have been looking for a shorter inseam pair of shorts (I have short legs lol). These truly were a great deal - perfect fit at 38 (oddly more forgiving than other OR pants) with excellent breathability and stretch. My only negative is that these are discontinued and the replacement seems to be a shorter version with a faux fly (doesn't work for me) and a built in belt (also doesn't work for me). Please Team OR, BRING THESE BACK!!! Hahaha :)
review.name: Excellent Shorts!

review.reviewBody: I bought these Ferrosi 10" shorts with the following activities in mind: hiking, mountain biking, everyday use in warm weather. So far I've used them for hiking and biking and they have been great for both. Fit is perfect, just loose enough for comfort but not baggy. They stretch to match body movement. I'm 5'10 200 lb with a "dad body" and the 36" waist fits well. It's only been about 15 degrees Celsius but I think they will be quite comfortable in the summer heat. Will be buying again!
review.name: Great shorts for many activities!

review.reviewBody: Slighty improved from the last generation - nice surprise as newer generations usually get worse in quality. Kudos!
review.name: Good replacement

name: Ferrosi Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: Love these boots. They are stylish and comfortable. They may run a bit on the large side, but they are great with thick socks. They are great everyday boots during the Northern California rainy season
review.name: Stylish and comfortable

review.reviewBody: These boots boast charm, resilience against water, and unparalleled comfort. Yet, their slip-resistant claim is as absent as a ship in a desert. Purchased for my maritime abode, I envisioned them as my trusty non-slip allies. Alas, as I descended the ladder amidst rain’s embrace, they orchestrated a rather comical descent of my own. Even the stairs’ nonslip embellishments were no match for their slippery nature, nearly evicting me from the dockside. Proceed with caution, or perhaps a sense of adventure akin to a high seas escapade.
review.name: NOT Slip Resistant
comment:
Hello,
We are sorry to hear that these boots are not performing as expected.  Please reach out to xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com.  We want you to be 100% satisfied with your purchase.

review.reviewBody: LOVE these playful deck boots! I find they are a little more fitted than my other ankle deck boots in a nice way - they offer a bit more of a hug. The grip is great and they're my current favourites!
review.name: Daily driver

review.reviewBody: Great versatility and love the color!  Very easy to get on and off too.
review.name: Great wet weather boot

review.reviewBody: Love the comfort level and the look.  Definitely runs small.  Buy 1/2 size up so it's more comfortable with socks.
review.name: Super comfy, little tight

review.reviewBody: Absolutely best barn shoes ever. This is my second pair and the last ones lasted over three years slogging all year long twice a day.
review.name: Best Barn shoes ever!

review.reviewBody: Great short boots!! I have a pair of the regular extra tuff boots and wanted a shorter pair that would slip on quickly for days when there is less snow. These are perfect and I love the vintage colors. I got lots of comments the first time I wore them.
review.name: Great shorter extra tuff womens boot

review.reviewBody: Best purchase I’ve made in months. They’re warm, waterproof, easy on and off, super comfortable and I don’t know how I ever lived in Alaska without them
review.name: Will recommend to anyone who will listen

review.reviewBody: First pair of xtratufs that I’ve bought and I could not be happier. I had a pair of Blundstones prior to these bad boys and I can say I prefer the tufs over those. They have a lot more room for a thicker sock and there is plenty of room in the ankle to be able to slip these on quickly. When these need to be retired I will be buying another pair of tufs.
review.name: Great boot!

review.reviewBody: I’ve gotten a lot of use out of these deck boots in a short amount of time. Never gotten so many compliments on work boots before!
review.name: Xtratuffs for life

name: Ankle Deck Vintage 6in Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Love the front pockets, stretch fabric is really nice, gaiters are perfect witdh for ski boots. Side zip are easy to slide with one hand. Instep patches are very large to protect the bottom of the pants. They are really very comfortable even when I add my insulated shorts. My friends want them too!!
review.name: Great touring pants

review.reviewBody: It seems like they thought of everything in this pant. The built in waist belt, the protective phone or beacon pocket, venting zips. Lightweight yet durable. I have only been out on one tour, but love them so far.
review.name: Dawn Patrol

review.reviewBody: I bought these in Carbon and was really excited because they’re light, move well and are well thought out in function. I’m a 30 in waist/40 in hips and the large is nice and roomy but I cinch the waist quite a bit, maybe could have gone medium. Unfortunately the lightweight fabric on the pockets and thighs started piling within a few uses and after a couple weeks of daily use and now they look like a pair of cheap sweats. It’s not a place where my backpack rubs so there’s not a ton of friction, not sure how it’s even happened. My husband has had the men’s version of these for over a year in black and doesn’t have any piling. Slightly disappointing.
review.name: Piling

review.reviewBody: I haven’t worn these yet but they fit perfect and are super flattering! I am 5’2” 105 lbs and the xs fits like it was custom made! They are so cute! The fabric and everything are well made, I wouldn’t expect anything less than great from BD. Excited to try these out on my next mountaineering expedition.
review.name: Great pants!

review.reviewBody: These are excellent ski pants for a day on the slopes or a long tour day - comfortable, breathable - I'll be using these daily.
review.name: Finally! Ski pants that fit and move well in the backcountry

review.reviewBody: I ordered these but had to return them due to sizing issues. I hadn’t used them but they were lightweight and what I’m looking for in a backcountry ski pant -breathable but some gortex in the places that matter. But they are very long. I’m 5’2” and cannot find a a good backcountry pant made for shorter women. These were a good 4-5 inches too long.
review.name: Hybrid ski pants

review.reviewBody: Have only worn them twice but so far I like these pants. I love that the thigh pockets are gusseted to open *out* to give room for electronics and other bulky items. I like that the waist sits right on top of my hip bones so the pants actually stay up and don't gap. My one complaint would be that the pants still fit pretty snug around the thigh and butt (my measurements are right in the middle of the suggested range for the size too). Form fitting isn't needed in this item and more room for movement and layering would be appreciated.
review.name: Great so far

review.reviewBody: Can't wait to wear these on a tour! I need to size up. Normally wear small and it would be so snug with anything underneath.
review.name: Can't wait to wear these

review.reviewBody: I’ve had these for 2 seasons and I love them. So stretchy, comfortable, they look good. I use them everyday for work up north. I wish you guys would make bibs with like this pants!!! Also having suspenders included would be great, haven’t found them on the website to purchase separately
review.name: The best pants !

review.reviewBody: These have a great fit- not too tight, not too loose. They are very lightweight so good for spring days too. The cuffs just barely fit over my Zero G boots in tour mode however, and I wish the beacon pocket was more secure like my old Mission pants. In avalanches, clothing can get torn and pockets can get ripped off- I like how the old style pants had an actual harness in the pocket that attaches to the waist belt. I like keeping my beacon in the pocket because it keeps it away from my radio and other gear when ski patrolling. The pockets could also be an inch or two higher, but overall I really like them and I sort of want them in purple now too!
review.name: Great touring pants

name: Dawn Patrol Hybrid Pant - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Brooks Divide 5 Trail Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Has been a comfortable shoe right out of the box and while breaking them in.

Great trail shoe! I bought these to replace my old Divide 5s which had Gore-tex water proofing. My new Divides do not have Gore-tex (which was my fault for not paying attention) and I really miss it! This shoe feels springy and light, fits nicely with my foot shape, and gives me that forward assist that I prefer with running/walking shoes. I use these for trail hiking and walking in adverse Michigan weather. I will really miss the Gore-tex in the spring!  However, I am keeping the shoes because I like the fit, colorway, and performance in drier conditions. Also, no break in period needed (which I can't say for the Gore-tex version!).
review.name: Comfortable trail shoe!

review.reviewBody: These shoes are good for light trails and I have used them for road running as well. They feel great with good traction.
review.name: Good light trail runner

review.reviewBody:
Got these in a different color
Although I do like how these blue one look😀😀😃😃😀😀

I got a total of 8 pairs of brooks

Just Love the 
Look and Feel
Of these shoes

Highly recommend

Great trainers! I wanted a pair of running trainers with good traction for light trails in the autumn and winter and these are perfect. No skidding on wet leaves or slippery inclines. I did a parkrun in them this weekend and they are also just as good on the road. Very pleased to have found these.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Love these new trail shoes - so glad I made that purchase
I usually love all my Brooks sneakers but these are the worst I’ve bought. Shotty material, hurts my pinky toes. I always wear the same size/width but these are very uncomfortable.
Narrow hurts my pinky toes, rubs the side of my pinky toes

WOW I am impressed with this bad boy. I just ran ManHump and these shoes kept my feet comfortable for 13 hours. ALSO -- I didn't have to relace them ONCE. The laces stayed -- no slipping! I was running up and down single track mountain trails with plenty of roots, rocks, and rockface, and folks these shoes let me run DOWN the rockface without fearing I would fall on MY face. 

I wear a size 11 and have weird narrow, bony feet that often slip around in trail shoes, but NOT THESE! Plenty of space in the toe box for stability, but narrow enough in the mid foot and heel that my feet stay in place. After many mountain miles, I have ZERO blisters and the shoes have ZERO holes. Love it.
review.name: Durable and comfortable for technical terrain

review.reviewBody: Excellent fit, lightweight and extremely comfortable. I work in a primary school and chose the Divide5 to be my new sports shoes. I couldn't be happier! Great on the oval, running up stairs, in the classroom, cross country training, and then grocery grab at the supermarket on the way home! The Divide5 are a treat on my feet! They look amazing, great value  and excellent Brooks quality. Highly recommend.
review.name: Look good. Feel great. Love wearing all day.

name: Divide 5 Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Force Grid Synthetic-Merino Wool Blend Quarter Sock - Men's
review.reviewBody: The sock itself is ok. The picture and the advertising for the Sock is misleading as it shows I believe what is a short crew sock but this is a very low / ankle sock and was not as shown or described as a quarter sock. This was misleading and unfortunate for me. Hopefully others don't make the same mistake looking at picture and assuming that it is the correct sock in the pictures.very disappointed.
review.name: Disappointed

review.itemreviewed: Everyday Cable Ankle Boot Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: This socks are great: high enough that they don’t slip down in the shoe, low and loose enough that they are very comfortable and not at all binding, and the merino wool fabric means that my feet stay comfortable and don’t get sweaty.
review.name: Perfect for me

review.itemreviewed: Everyday Cable Ankle Boot Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: Changing my socks to wool was a game changer, they hold more moisture, don't smell as bad and are all around more comfortable for daily and exercise wear. Worth the extra cost up front
review.name: Wool is superior!

review.itemreviewed: Everyday Cable Ankle Boot Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfort. L9ve them
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.itemreviewed: Everyday Cable Ankle Boot Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: I can see why someone who loves typical smart wool sock might not like these (like some reviewers here). They are looser than other SW socks and that's why I LOVE THEM! They are perfect and exactly what I love in a sock! I'm a small person but have fat ankles and these don't cut off my ankle and make me feel gross. And I personally love the length. They stay up just fine for me! Size 6 shoe size small socks. Love love love these! I got mine at Sierra and now coming to the website to order more. Don't love the price but...
review.name: Different from other smart wool socks

review.itemreviewed: Everyday Cable Ankle Boot Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A nice sock...
review.name: Nice Sock

review.itemreviewed: Everyday Cable Ankle Boot Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Here in North Central Florida winter temps can literally range from 15-80 F. Now that I exclusively wear Smartwool socks, my feet are never cold or hot, even when wet. They have been a real boost to my comfort level. Also their odor is neutral whether I wear my worst farm work shoes, or my going into town shoes. Thanks Smartwool.
review.name: Ready For Any Weather Situation

review.itemreviewed: Everyday Cable Ankle Boot Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: Nice, very colorful but they DO NOT STAY UP!! Always pulling them up, it's annoying when you spend an insane price for a quality sock, then they keep falling off. Yes, I bought the correct size.
review.name: These socks

review.itemreviewed: Everyday Cable Ankle Boot Sock - Women's

review.reviewBody: This shoe’s liner will rip within days of use, even if sized comfortably. I would not recommend these to anyone. It’s very unfortunate that they basically remade the OG 510 dragon but it’s such a low quality control standard, that the shoe is not suited for climbing. It will not hold up to the wear and tear of rock climbing, especially outdoors. I ordered a Comfortably sized pair, and the lining on the heel ripped within 2 hour long bouldering sessions. I sent them back for warranty replacement and right when I got my package, I went straight to the gym to test them out to have both of the heels at the same spot within an hour of climbing. The first pair I thought was just effective, but that’s not the case. This company has horrible quality control standards and I would stay away from purchasing any of their products unless you wanna keep dealing with warranty replacements every couple days. It’s a shame that these shoes are made in America at the original 510 warehouses with some of the original employees that used to make the 510 shoes that we all know and love, and they can’t hold up for more than a day. A lot of people talk crap about the 510 China made shoes, but the heels don’t rip on those shoes and they hold up for at least a few months without any rips or delamination. Buyer beware!
review.name: The shoe will rip

review.reviewBody:
This is an improved Five Ten Dragon. It's a bit stiffer than the dragon but still has a lot of sensitivity along with a way better fitting heel. I like sensitive shoes but I use this anytime I need to edge. 
I'm a 9.5 street shoe. 
UP Sirius 9
UP Leopard 9
Five Ten Team, Anasazi Arrow, Dragon, and Hornet all size 9
La Sportiva Women's Solution 40.0
Mad Rock Remora and Sharks 9
I've had these for a couple years and I've had them resoled once. The heel rubber and toe rubber is finally delaminating but I've gotten a ton of use out of them. Unparallel does a really good job on resoling in case anyone is interested. Can't recommend enough.
review.name: Muy Bien. love em

name: Sirius Lace Shoe

hasVariant.description: Buy the Giordana Sport Long Sleeve Top - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I should preface this by saying that I'm forever stuck between a medium and a large in almost all brands. The Medium size has a good fit in the chest/body, but feels very narrow in the shoulders/armpits, very short in sleeve length (maybe that's so it'll fit under long-sleeve jerseys? I don't know). If I sized up to a Large, I feel like the body would start to get baggy but the shoulder width and sleeve length might be more appropriate. Slim cut, but not fitted, and not very stretchy material.

Fabric is pretty lightweight, and reasonably breathable. Wicks sweat just okay, I would say a good temperature range for this base layer is 60-75*F (16-24*C). Definitely not recommended for properly chilly conditions. My main concern is durability. I have noticed a significant amount of pilling beginning on one sleeve after one use and a gentle (hand) wash. Time will tell.

I wish I could say this was a steal at $35 that works as well as fancy expensive base layers, but alas it isn't so.
review.name: You get what you pay for

name: Sport Long Sleeve Top - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Re:Connect Here Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I spent two long weeks hiking portions of the Arizona Trail north of the north rim of the Grand Canyon. It's a fairly good trail not to rough, where we hiked. I put about 150 miles on them and was very surprised. The sole stiffness is just right for hiking (much stiffer than sneakers), traction is good, and the gussets on the tip of the shoe and along the tongue do a good job of keeping out small stones and other debris. The most striking things are the great cushioning (no sore feet) and the stability. I can recommend them without hesitation. I just ordered a pair of the high top version of these for my wife!
review.name: Great Shoes for light Hiking, Very good design!
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your shoes are working well for you, no matter the terrain. We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.itemreviewed: Re:Connect Here Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: By far the lightest shoes I've ever owned and among the most comfortable, too. Plenty of support, well-constructed. I wouldn't recommend wearing these shoes in the rain, but for a hot summer day or walking around the city, they are just about perfect. Love the rust color, too!
review.name: Excellent light-weight summer sneakers
comment:
We are happy to hear that these will be your new go-to summertime shoes! We hope you get many miles out of them.
Thank you for the review and for supporting our brand!

review.itemreviewed: Re:Connect Here Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shoes are incredibly comfortable! The stack height and midsole are well-cushioned, but not so much that they feel unsupportive. The see-through mesh upper provides a ton of breathability for someone with hot feet (me). I generally wear sandals all summer to keep my feet cool, but I think with a thin sock these might do the trick! My favorite feature is the lug pattern on the bottom. By having flatter lugs that still provide some traction, these shoes walk well whether it's solid pavement or light rocky dirt trails. Naturally, that makes it perfect for those who like to sneak in a lunch hike or trail run while still providing smooth walking at the office. The wrap-around tongue and padding near the Achilles help a lot with dialing in fit and providing security and comfort. Quick note on heel-toe drop since I don't see it listed here or on the Vasque site. They do have quite a significant drop. I generally wear shoes at 5mm or less, so the higher drop is quite noticeable, but certainly not a bad thing.
review.name: Really Great Every Day Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Re:Connect Here Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've been rocking these shoes for a while now and have really put them through their paces.  From climbing around on the rocks and balds of the Blue Ridge mountains, walking creeks with a fly rod, catching snakes in the swamps of south Florida, or snatching bass while I'm out on my boat, these things have done it all. I've pushed these shoes really hard, and have been super impressive with their grippyness on a variety of surfaces, the nice balance between cushion and flexibility, and how easy they are to get in and out of.  I never want to take these things off!!
review.name: These Shoes CRUSH!
comment: Hi, thanks for this awesome review! We love hearing stories like yours! We hope to continue serving you and meeting your expectations!

review.itemreviewed: Re:Connect Here Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe a few weeks ago and it now my everyday go to!  The extended heel feels like your not even walking on pavement.  Very lightweight and breathable with a mesh upper as well
review.name: COMFORTABLE SHOE
comment: Thank you for your review! I am glad to hear we have lived up to your expectations regarding the performance!

name: Re:Connect Here Low Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Winter Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I had relied on my Zamberlain boots for a decade to keep my feet dry, warm and comfortable when backpacking where I knew the conditions would be a challenge. They were heavy but superbly reliable.
I bought theses Salewa boots based on a friends endorsement. 
They turned out to be a wonderful surprise. Since these boots were not locally available I followed Salewa’s sizing directions  closely, upsized  by 1/2  and they fit perfectly.  
They are 1/3 the weight of my Zamberlain boots yet fit my needs perfectly. Cold, wet, rocky trails have been no problem. 
My new boots exceeded my expectations. Turned out to be a great decision. I’ll miss my old boots because they reminded me of past great trips but not for long.
review.name: Warm, dry, light on one’s feet:

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Winter Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Extremely comfortable boot for everyday wear!

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Winter Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are my 3rd pair of Salewa, they have always been comfortable and durable.  The waterproofing on my last pair did fail on me after 6 months of light use, will see how these hold up.
review.name: So far so good

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Winter Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nothing but a great experience so far

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Winter Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable boots. Warm and waterproof in the snow. Worn them for hiking in mud, snow, and very cold and windy conditions. Very grippy sole. Did I mention that they are insanely comfortable. My normal size 13 fits perfectly with thick wool hiking socks. My favorite boots now.
review.name: Great Winter Boots

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Winter Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought these for some Winter CO 14er summit attempts. First use was on Quandry on New Years Day. I traditionally use alpine trail runners and have not purchased a pair of boots for almost a decade at this point. With a high of 5 degrees, windchill in the negatives, and a couple inches of fresh snow, these boots were absolutely bomb proof. Sleek profile that act much beefier than they look. If you are looking for a pair of winter boots that are not too bulky but still get the job done, get these!
review.name: CO Winter 14er

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Winter Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Compare to MOUNTAIN TRAINER 2 MID GORE-TEX® BOOT, this boot is warmer and much more secure in snow and ice. Comfortable for both, long walkings and steep hikes.
review.name: Comfortable warm boot with secure grip

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Winter Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The Alp Mate Winter shoe is a great hiking shoes for Alaska. Having been extremely satisfied with the Wildfire approach shoes, ai decided to try the Alp Mate Winter for work in AK. I am often in Katmai National Park and live in the nearby surrounding area all year long. These shoes literally grip ice as I walk. I was amazed at how much traction they provided on flat ice. I've never owned shoes that grip ice so well. Like other Salewa shoes, they are super comfortable. From day one I was able to work a full 10-hour shift without any issues.  Salewa, please keep make these. They are simply the best shoes on the market for subfreezing temps in the mountains of southern Alaska.
review.name: Amazing Traction on Ice! Great Hiking, Trekking Shoes for Alaska

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Winter Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots are comfortable, lightweight and hold up incredibly well.
review.name: Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Winter Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: i’m very happy with the boots look and their respective quality
review.name: general

name: Alp Mate Winter Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: I love these boots! I’m tempted to purchase a second pair!
review.name: Awesome

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Short WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I finally found my winter walking boot!  These are comfortable and warm.  The side zipper allows my medium width foot to fit in the toe without slipping in the heel, and they are easy to get on and off.  I love them!
review.name: Fits Well

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Short WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: You'll want to like this boot but there are some odd misses in quality for Sorel. The zipper is tiny, literally looks like a dwlicate zipper that you'd see on a dress. A boot like this should have a much more rugged & substantial zipper. On the inside of the boot near the zipper there is a fold of material that rubs. And finally although the opening has a faus fur lining the foot of the boot isn't very insulated, it's more like a regular tennis shoe.
review.name: Odd Miss For Sorel
comment: Hello Aimee B., we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry KINETIC™ Impact Short Women's Waterproof Boot didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Short WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have another version of these with a black sole from about 5 years ago. They are super! Wearing them for trip to Vienna Christmas markets. Cold tonight and feet were warm. Wear them to walk dog in cold winters and they are stylish enough to wear to nice event. Always get positive complements on them from my friends. I have very wide feet so bought half size up which I do with boots. I bought this latest version of the boot with the white sole and it’s as comfortable as my old pair.
review.name: Warm and Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Short WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I own a pair of these boots that I purchased a couple of years ago and will be wearing again this winter as have held up quite well. I do a lot of walking and these are very comfortable and stylish. I have received multiple compliments on, and requests of where to purchase a pair.
review.name: Everyone should own a pair of these boots

review.reviewBody: I purchased the CX242 Wide shoe in hopes that I could finally find a shoe that fit my EEEE width feet. The Lake CX242 wide is the best fitting cycling shoe I have tried. The leather uppers conform to the foot, the dual tightening knobs make for a snug fit where you need it and allow quick on and off. The carbon sole is super stiff. Now for my extra wide foot the fit is not perfect, but way better than many other options out there.
review.name: Good Fit for Wide Feet

review.reviewBody:
Tried this CX242 Wide, size 44, while searching for a low to medium volume shoe with a toe box that does not curve in against the big toe. 

The Lake size chart recommended sizing from 43 to 43.5: I found the size 44 in both this model and the CX201 to be more accurate. My feet measure 272mm in length, 105mm wide at the balls/metatarsals of the feet, with toe splay a few mm wider than the balls/metatarsals, narrow to normal heel volume and low arches. For further reference, I have worn 44.5 in both Bont and Specialized current model shoes. I was hoping for the toe box room of the recently tried CX201s with more support and less volume throughout the rest of the shoe.
 
The heel cup and general fit were supportive and adjustable as Lake stated, up to the ball of the foot. Then the toe box curved in against the natural position of the big toe, even with this wide version and the adjustable panels of the upper. The unnatural curve is not as pronounced as in other brands but still too much forcing the big toe inward.

The CX201 sole with the CX242 upper would-be a near perfect shoe.
Thank you Backcountry for further fit details and allowing me to try both shoes.
review.name: Great support, but narrow toe box

review.reviewBody: I use to ware citi bike shoes but they were very narrow.I tried these lake wide shoes and I’ve had no issues with my feet since.they are very comfortable and easy to put on and remove.
review.name: Good fit

review.reviewBody:
I have very wide, duck-foot shaped feet with prominent bunions.  I wear Altra sneakers most of the time and have my ski boots punched to accommodate my bunions.  Owned a pair of Lake 219 Wides but then got hit and trashed my shoes in the process.  Went for the CX242 Wides as replacements and man, if I'd only known....  These are, without doubt, the most comfortable bike shoe I've used in 35 years of riding. Independent strap for forefoot accommodates my bunion and more squared-off toe box leaves room for the other toes.  Inner sole is pretty supportive and outersole is rigid enough for pretty serious recreational rider (100-125 miles a week).  
If you have problematic feet of the wide type, I highly recommend these.  They are spendy for an amateur, but worth every penny -- especially as the miles pile up. I never knew the 219's subtly cramped my feet, but these made me relax my toes.  I upsized 1/2 a size, but not sure if that's the shoes or my aging, enlarging feet.
review.name: Most comfortable shoe ever!

review.reviewBody: This is one of the most comfortable cycling shoes I've ever worn.  I have a wide forefoot and narrow heel, and need a wide toe box.  The 242 in a wide has a noticeably wider toe box than the standard width 242, and is the first cycling shoe that has fit my feet well. I also have a bony protrusion in the side of my foot that makes a standard shoe difficult to fit, and the adjustability of the 242 solves my problem. The shoes are very well made, and combined with the great fit make for a terrific shoe.
review.name: Fantastic Fit

name: CX242 Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is a good looking shoe and loved the colour but it was very wide and deep for her foot and the tongue was hard on the ankle when she walked.
review.name: This is a good looking

review.reviewBody: My son has only been wearing these for 6 weeks and they are falling apart. Literally. I will not be buying keen shoes again and will just stick to their sandals. My son did say they did keep his feet dry when it rained when he walked to school until they started falling apart.
review.name: Falling apart.

review.reviewBody: The pictures say it all--not sure what the issue is here, but the shoes immediately began falling apart, after normal wear on the playground. They are also not as waterproof as we hoped, but that's a lesser issue. Disappointing, because they looked really cool.
review.name: Falling apart after a week!

review.reviewBody: My daughter wore them a few times but complains every time that they hurt her feet. Just a waste of money for us, I guess. They do seem waterproof (which she desperately needs), so, back to square one I guess. She thought they were cute too!
review.name: Not comfortable

review.reviewBody: My kids destroyed these in less than 6 months. All of the shiny areas are peeling off and the inside heel has completely disintegrated. Not keens usual durability. I would not buy these again.
review.name: Don’t hold up

review.reviewBody: I have yet to be disappointed from keen. My son has very wide feet and also has gait issues. These shoes give him great support without constricting his feet. They are very weak made.
review.name: Love these shoes.

review.reviewBody: My only complaint is that it runs larger than the chandler style. So it is too big for now, but kids grow so fast I bet it will fit before we know it. I ended up buying another chandler in the same size (big kid 1) that fits much better for my daughter.
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My daughter of obsessed with these shoes! They fit her perfectly! She’s in between a size 1-1.5 and I got the size 1 and she says they fit great! Enough room for her toes. I’m so glad I got here these shoes.
review.name: Obsessed

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought 3 pairs of shoes all at the same time (all size 5). The other 2 were very close in sizing. The wanduro was a centimeter longer and much narrower. Had to return.
review.name: Sizing way off

review.reviewBody: My husband bought these shoes size big kids 7 for our 10 year old grandson, who wears a big kids size 6.5. The shoes are a good quality, the color is nice, although we don't known yet how waterproof they are, but there is a big problem with the size. They are huge! They are even big on me, and I wear wide shoes, size 8.5 for woman. Keen messed up with sizes. We left this shoes for future, in couple years it will be good on our grandson.
review.name: Size is not right

name: Wanduro Low WP Shoe - Kids'

comment: We are very sorry to hear the material wasn't quite as expected. Our Product Team is constantly working to develop gear that best suits our athletes and their needs. This feedback is appreciated, and we will be sure to give them a closer look!

review.reviewBody: They fit perfectly and feel great.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: Received several compliments while wearing these.   They are so comfortable and waist doesn’t roll down.
review.name: So Soft

review.reviewBody: These pants are my new favorite
review.name: Great workout gear

review.reviewBody: It's been a couple years since I purchased these pants. I was very disappointed with the quality when they finally arrived. The fabric is significantly thinner than it was previously, and the waistband has no structure anymore. These are a favourite pant of mine, I've been wearing them for 12 years. This, unfortunately, may be the last one I buy. Not worth the money imo anymore unless you're looking for a very light pant. The difference in weight between these new ones and my old ones is noticeable. Pne thing i appreciated about these pants was the thickness of the material, I found it to be softer and more comfortable. Not loving the change.
review.name: Not like they used to be
comment: We are sorry these pants did not work out for you. We highly appreciate the honest feedback, as we are always looking for ways to enhance our athlete experience.

review.reviewBody: ordered these in a medium which is the size needed. These seem like and extra small with absolutely no stretch in the waist. It was to be a Christmas gift now cannot give. So disappointed!
review.name: too small
comment: We are very sorry to learn that the size of these pants wasn't quite right, and we appreciate the honest feedback! Our team will be reaching out to you via email to address your concerns.

review.reviewBody: Ordered tall length and still too short.
comment: We are very sorry to hear the fit of these pants wasn't quite right for you and appreciate you taking the time to provide us with this feedback. We have forwarded your review to our Product Development Team for examination.

review.reviewBody: I have been on a hunt for soo long for the perfect pair of yoga pants and these are it!! The fit is soo comfortable and flattering. It holds where it needs to and the length/flare is perfect. I immediately bought more as soon as I put these pants on. If you are looking for a great fit- this is it!!!
review.name: THE BEST

review.itemreviewed: Trollveggen Thermal Pro Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love the color and fit (long in the back which is great for tall people). Great for work. Comfy and warm. After a month or so it is pilling a bit but I guess that's too be expected with this material. M Fits perfect for me at 6'2 175.
review.name: Very good

review.itemreviewed: Trollveggen Thermal Pro Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love the fit of this fleece. It's hip length, so doesn't interfere with activity, and Norrona's longer arm length suits me well. The neck is super cosy and it's generally toasty. Love the three pockets (sat higher to accommodate waist belt). Feels very durable and still lightweight. Zips and toggles great.
review.name: Warm, Great Fit and Functional

review.itemreviewed: Trollveggen Thermal Pro Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've only had a few fleece jackets in my life. Most a long time ago. But recently, I've been looking for a form fitting, mid layer, warm (but not hot) fleece to go under my Norrona shell or wear on it's own to the gym or for hikes when it's not below 35*. This fits the bill across the board! It's the best fleece I've ever owned. Yes, it's more expensive than most products similar to it, but a lot of the time, you get what you pay for. And this jacket is amazing!

The fit is unreal... if you're in shape. I'm very tall, fit and muscular, and it's very hard to find tops or jackets that fit my body. Tall body, long arms, but form fitting in the hips and waist, then a bit of room in the chest and shoulders for musculature. It's almost impossible to find that. Yet this jacket feels like it was custom made for me! I normally wear a L in almost all clothes, but it seems more and more like Outdoor brands and Sports gear is 1/2 a size to 1 full size smaller. I did some research all over the internet and the consensus was that this jacket fits a bit snug for it's size. So to size up. And I'm glad I did! This XL fits like a normal L. Yet, the body and sleeves are nice and long! I'm 6'6" and there's still a bit of room in the sleeves! And it actually comes down below belt level in the front and half way down my butt in the back. It's absolutely perfect!

And it says it's 100% recycled material. Is warm, but not hot. Has a nice high collar, the wrists have a thumb holes and a soft spongy like performance shirt like material right at the end of the wrist. It's snug, but not tight and keeps wind from getting up the sleeves. It's a VERY nice little touch that other brands don't have. 

Overall, this is the best fleece I've ever had and I love it! Fits like it's tailor made for me and grabbed it while it was on sale. Couldn't ask for more. 


Only problem I have with the whole experience is Backcountry themselves. I had ordered another fleece jacket, it didn't fit and needed to talk with a gear expert about other options. The CS rep on the chat could not help. They also somehow, could not find any gear expert around to help?! Which makes no sense. Middle of the day on a weekday is prime business hrs. You'd think they'd have at least 1 or a few gear experts around to help answer gear questions, like they advertise that they have. But they didn't. The CS rep said they'd get my questions to a gear expert and get back with me very soon. Well. it's bee 3-4 days and I haven't heard a thing and had to do a bunch of my own research scouring the internet. CS here and at most places is literally non-existent at this point in human existence. It's absolutely pathetic and I think I've only had 1 or 2 great CS experiences with any company in the last 2-3 years. It makes me not want to shop with Backcountry anymore.
review.name: Fantastic Form Fitting Fleece

review.itemreviewed: Trollveggen Thermal Pro Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought it for my son in medium.  He is 6 ft and about 160 pounds.  Very insulating with great all around movement with no restriction.  Sleeve length is fine.  Norrona tends to be a bit narrower in the midsection / chest area - so it won’t be a baggy fit.  If you are slender or athletically built, it will work great.  Has great pocket space.  Indigo blue is a very nice color, looks better in person and while he is wearing it than in pics.  Another high quality product from Norrona.
review.name: Great fleece

review.itemreviewed: Trollveggen Thermal Pro Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I now have two of these things, not sure why. I wear XL and the fit is fairly accurate, and they are very comfortable as a light jacket or a layer in the system. The colors on the other hand are a bit off, maybe we should call them muted. I have the Cold Black which is gray and Arednalin which is a funny orange/ red color.

They are not wind resistant but with a shell do what they are supposed to do. I managed to trash one of the zippers,  Norrona fixed it no charge.  I am a bit of a gear snob and the smashed bird brand is what I wear exclusively for climbing till I needed a pair of gor tex bibs/ pant for climbing in Scotland. I now have several pieces of Norrona gear and they have held up well and as I stated above, my fault and Norrona fixed it. 
I live in the PNW and have been using synthetic puff jackets for insulation ( light, pack well and if wrung out  will still keep you warm after a fashion) This fleece does fairly well when wet and body heat will dry things out a bit faster than puffs. More bulky so a trade off at times.

After wearing these things ( Noronna gear in general) in some really bad weather and rough climbing I would say the gear competes with the Big Guys for performance, wear and price.
review.name: Great Fleece

review.itemreviewed: Trollveggen Thermal Pro Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Love the actual more muted or toned down blue color vs the bright Olympian Blue shown in the pic. Its hard to describe but kind of an indigo blue steel that had a child with a brighter Olympia Blue. Way more classy color than the pic here on BC. 
  So fit wise at 5'11" in my socks and 170lbs with a 34 waist and in my 60's. Have a bit broader shoulders and longer arms so I chose a large over the medium which was a tailored painted on fit that would be used solely as a layering piece. The large still tailored down through the hips was just a better all around fit and still looks svelte. 
  So I have gone this route before to use under my Norrona GTX Lofoten shell and its great for in bounds but prolly not going to aggressively hike with it very much. It creates warmth but its not windproof. That's why I wear a small pack and carry a different insulation or wind blocking  mid layer to swap out. Really a nice piece though and glad to have it in the clothing quiv.
review.name: Super Fleece

review.itemreviewed: Trollveggen Thermal Pro Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: 6ft, 165lbs and I purchased a medium in grey. Overall great fit for me with a slightly fitted cut with generous sleeve and body length. Enough space for a few base layers. Feels well made like an arcteryx item.
review.name: Soft cozy warm technical fleece

name: Trollveggen Thermal Pro Fleece Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Kamber 30L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Kamber 30L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Kamber 30L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] For ski season, this is an outstanding pack. First, on travel to the mountains, I was able to attach this to my Farpoint 55 which is helpful since I was planning on packing it in my ski bag, which would’ve been a tight fit. At the mountain, it’s a comfortable bag. It’s so quick and easy to attack your skis to the sides of the pack to give you hands free commute up certain ridge lines or even to and from lodging. Extremely helpful if you have a 5 year old kid who doesn’t carry any of his gear. The rescue pocket easily stores your rescue/med gear for quick access. The goggle safe pocket is a great touch. Accessing the main compartment via the back panel vs the top is also well thought out especially when touring. Just laid my bag on the skis and no issues with snow breaking the threshold or the bag falling over when your in this uncomfortable stress positions. I’m gonna try the osprey camel bag next time, tried to use one I typically use for hiking but it wasn’t sized quite right and kept kinking the line. I wish there were one or two gear loops and maybe a vertical ratch strap for a rope. I’ll play with that more next year. It is also a very durable feeling pack. I’ll most likely do a video next year as I have more things to add.
review.name: For ski season, this is

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack as a refresh for my old generalist 15-year old Mountain Hardware before a Heli-Assisted Ski Touring trip to Revelstoke-area Canada. This was an incredible upgrade. There is easy-access backcountry-gear specific niches for everything. Avalanche gear, goggles, helmet, skins, clothing layers, water bladder, and snacks.  I really cannot imagine a better designed pack for backcountry day trip. (Would be too small for overnight hut to huts).
review.name: A Place for Everything

name: Kamber 30L Backpack
Kamber 30L Backpack

hasVariant.name: Chariot Cadence 2 + Bicycle Trailer Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Chariot Cadence 2 + Bicycle Trailer Kit online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this approx a month ago. I wanted to be able to take my grandkids out for a ride. I have a e-bike with fat tires as we live on gravel roads. I will also ride across fields or dirt paths. This cart worked very well on all of the above. But note the fat tires on my bike make the cart very close to the bike. My 3 year old grandson can touch the back wheel with his feet. We would need an extension (which I have not looked into). 
As well I have taken this out when it has been raining a small amount. The tires spit mud onto the cart. So just make sure you have the clear cover that is with the cart down. Or you might have screaming kids. Lol
As a side note. Be aware you will need an additional attachment to fix it to a e-bike if you have a hub drive bike. 
Overall the cart seams well made and the kids love it.
review.name: Fun

review.reviewBody: I bought this product a month or so ago and I'm very happy I did.
review.name: Great features

review.reviewBody:
It’s a great quality bike trailer. However, when my 1.5 year old is riding alone, she tends to slide towards the middle. Also, while wearing her helmet, because it’s a flag back, the helmet gets pushed forward into her face. 

Would be better is the bottom seating area was more firm, to reduce sliding to the middle. And if there was padding at the back to account for helmet space.
review.name: Good quality, some features missing

review.reviewBody: I received my cadence as a Father’s Day gift from my family and it is great my grandkids love going for rides and especially when they end at a park , we have a lot of parks in our town and it has opened a lot more of them to us ( some were a little too far to walk to ) not anymore with a easy to use trailer
review.name: Works wonderfully

review.reviewBody: This has all the quality without all the extra fluff needed for a great bike carrier for kids.  Our toddler loves it and makes getting to neighborhood playgrounds so much more fun.
review.name: Perfect for toddlers!

review.reviewBody: Works awesome and the kiddos are safe and secure (also having a blast) in this! Protects them from all types of weather elements that occur along the ride.
review.name: Great product, kids love it!

review.reviewBody: I use it on the motorcycle it works excellent. Low profile carrys most of what of what I need.
review.name: Motto bag

review.reviewBody: I use it as a daily vehicle, the kids love. It's easy to pull with 50lbs of weight. My neice says she's flying when we take her out.
review.name: love it. bought it for my son, easy to use.

review.reviewBody: Easy to use and durable.
review.name: Great Trailer
